module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ActivityType

-- | Represents an activity type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityType</a> smart constructor.
data ActivityType
ActivityType' :: Text -> Text -> ActivityType

-- | The name of this activity.
--   
--   The combination of activity type name and version must be unique
--   within a domain.
[$sel:name:ActivityType'] :: ActivityType -> Text

-- | The version of this activity.
--   
--   The combination of activity type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
[$sel:version:ActivityType'] :: ActivityType -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ActivityType'</a>, <a>activityType_name</a> - The name of
--   this activity.
--   
--   The combination of activity type name and version must be unique
--   within a domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ActivityType'</a>, <a>activityType_version</a> - The
--   version of this activity.
--   
--   The combination of activity type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
newActivityType :: Text -> Text -> ActivityType

-- | The name of this activity.
--   
--   The combination of activity type name and version must be unique
--   within a domain.
activityType_name :: Lens' ActivityType Text

-- | The version of this activity.
--   
--   The combination of activity type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
activityType_version :: Lens' ActivityType Text

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.CancelTimerDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>CancelTimer</tt> decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCancelTimerDecisionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data CancelTimerDecisionAttributes
CancelTimerDecisionAttributes' :: Text -> CancelTimerDecisionAttributes

-- | The unique ID of the timer to cancel.
[$sel:timerId:CancelTimerDecisionAttributes'] :: CancelTimerDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CancelTimerDecisionAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timerId:CancelTimerDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>cancelTimerDecisionAttributes_timerId</a> - The unique ID of the
--   timer to cancel.
newCancelTimerDecisionAttributes :: Text -> CancelTimerDecisionAttributes

-- | The unique ID of the timer to cancel.
cancelTimerDecisionAttributes_timerId :: Lens' CancelTimerDecisionAttributes Text

--   and can be useful for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.CloseStatusFilter

-- | Used to filter the closed workflow executions in visibility APIs by
--   their close status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloseStatusFilter</a> smart constructor.
data CloseStatusFilter
CloseStatusFilter' :: CloseStatus -> CloseStatusFilter

-- | The close status that must match the close status of an execution for
--   it to meet the criteria of this filter.
[$sel:status:CloseStatusFilter'] :: CloseStatusFilter -> CloseStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>CloseStatusFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:CloseStatusFilter'</a>, <a>closeStatusFilter_status</a>
--   - The close status that must match the close status of an execution
--   for it to meet the criteria of this filter.
newCloseStatusFilter :: CloseStatus -> CloseStatusFilter

-- | The close status that must match the close status of an execution for
--   it to meet the criteria of this filter.
closeStatusFilter_status :: Lens' CloseStatusFilter CloseStatus

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>CompleteWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a>
--   smart constructor.
data CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | The result of the workflow execution. The form of the result is
--   implementation defined.
[$sel:result:CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:result:CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>completeWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_result</a> - The result
--   of the workflow execution. The form of the result is implementation
--   defined.
newCompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes :: CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | The result of the workflow execution. The form of the result is
--   implementation defined.
completeWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_result :: Lens' CompleteWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>DecisionTaskTimedOut</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes
DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes' :: DecisionTaskTimeoutType -> Integer -> Integer -> DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | The type of timeout that expired before the decision task could be
--   completed.
[$sel:timeoutType:DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes'] :: DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes -> DecisionTaskTimeoutType

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskScheduled</tt> event that was recorded
--   when this decision task was scheduled. This information can be useful
--   for diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up
--   to this event.
[$sel:scheduledEventId:DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes'] :: DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskStarted</tt> event recorded when this
--   decision task was started. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
[$sel:startedEventId:DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes'] :: DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutType:DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>decisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes_timeoutType</a> - The type of
--   timeout that expired before the decision task could be completed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduledEventId:DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>decisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes_scheduledEventId</a> - The ID
--   of the <tt>DecisionTaskScheduled</tt> event that was recorded when
--   this decision task was scheduled. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedEventId:DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>decisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes_startedEventId</a> - The ID of
--   the <tt>DecisionTaskStarted</tt> event recorded when this decision
--   task was started. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
newDecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes :: DecisionTaskTimeoutType -> Integer -> Integer -> DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | The type of timeout that expired before the decision task could be
--   completed.
decisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes_timeoutType :: Lens' DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes DecisionTaskTimeoutType

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskScheduled</tt> event that was recorded
--   when this decision task was scheduled. This information can be useful
--   for diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up
--   to this event.
decisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes_scheduledEventId :: Lens' DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes Integer

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskStarted</tt> event recorded when this
--   decision task was started. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
decisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes_startedEventId :: Lens' DecisionTaskTimedOutEventAttributes Integer

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter

-- | Used to filter the workflow executions in visibility APIs by various
--   time-based rules. Each parameter, if specified, defines a rule that
--   must be satisfied by each returned query result. The parameter values
--   are in the <a>Unix Time format</a>. For example: <tt>"oldestDate":
--   1325376070.</tt>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExecutionTimeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data ExecutionTimeFilter
ExecutionTimeFilter' :: Maybe POSIX -> POSIX -> ExecutionTimeFilter

-- | Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.
[$sel:latestDate:ExecutionTimeFilter'] :: ExecutionTimeFilter -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return.
[$sel:oldestDate:ExecutionTimeFilter'] :: ExecutionTimeFilter -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ExecutionTimeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:latestDate:ExecutionTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>executionTimeFilter_latestDate</a> - Specifies the latest start or
--   close date and time to return.
--   
--   <a>$sel:oldestDate:ExecutionTimeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>executionTimeFilter_oldestDate</a> - Specifies the oldest start or
--   close date and time to return.
newExecutionTimeFilter :: UTCTime -> ExecutionTimeFilter

-- | Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.
executionTimeFilter_latestDate :: Lens' ExecutionTimeFilter (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return.
executionTimeFilter_oldestDate :: Lens' ExecutionTimeFilter UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ExecutionTimeFilter.ExecutionTimeFilter


module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>FailWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | Details of the failure.
[$sel:details:FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | A descriptive reason for the failure that may help in diagnostics.
[$sel:reason:FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>failWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_details</a> - Details of
--   the failure.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>failWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_reason</a> - A descriptive
--   reason for the failure that may help in diagnostics.
newFailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes :: FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | Details of the failure.
failWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_details :: Lens' FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A descriptive reason for the failure that may help in diagnostics.
failWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_reason :: Lens' FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>FailWorkflowExecutionFailed</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes
FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes' :: FailWorkflowExecutionFailedCause -> Integer -> FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes

-- | The cause of the failure. This information is generated by the system
--   and can be useful for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:cause:FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes'] :: FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes -> FailWorkflowExecutionFailedCause

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>FailWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision to fail this execution. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
[$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes'] :: FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cause:FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>failWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_cause</a> - The cause of
--   the failure. This information is generated by the system and can be
--   useful for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>failWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>FailWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision to fail this execution. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
newFailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes :: FailWorkflowExecutionFailedCause -> Integer -> FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes

-- | The cause of the failure. This information is generated by the system
--   and can be useful for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
failWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_cause :: Lens' FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes FailWorkflowExecutionFailedCause

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>FailWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision to fail this execution. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
failWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId :: Lens' FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes Integer
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes.FailWorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>LambdaFunctionScheduled</tt> event. It
--   isn't set for other event types.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes
LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Integer -> LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes

-- | The input provided to the Lambda task.
[$sel:input:LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes'] :: LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Data attached to the event that the decider can use in subsequent
--   workflow tasks. This data isn't sent to the Lambda task.
[$sel:control:LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes'] :: LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum amount of time a worker can take to process the Lambda
--   task.
[$sel:startToCloseTimeout:LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes'] :: LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the Lambda task.
[$sel:id:LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes'] :: LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The name of the Lambda function.
[$sel:name:LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes'] :: LambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>LambdaFunctionCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision that resulted in scheduling this activity task. To help
--   diagnose issues, use this information to trace back the chain of
--   events leading up to this event.

--   provided to the Lambda task.

--   <a>lambdaFunctionScheduledEventAttributes_control</a> - Data attached
--   to the event that the decider can use in subsequent workflow tasks.
--   This data isn't sent to the Lambda task.

--   the Lambda task.

--   this event.

--   marker.

--   The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to

--   that requested this marker. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
markerRecordedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId :: Lens' MarkerRecordedEventAttributes Integer
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes.MarkerRecordedEventAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount

-- | Contains the count of tasks in a task list.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPendingTaskCount</a> smart constructor.
data PendingTaskCount
PendingTaskCount' :: Maybe Bool -> Natural -> PendingTaskCount

-- | If set to true, indicates that the actual count was more than the
--   maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated
--   value.
[$sel:truncated:PendingTaskCount'] :: PendingTaskCount -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of tasks in the task list.
[$sel:count:PendingTaskCount'] :: PendingTaskCount -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>PendingTaskCount</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:truncated:PendingTaskCount'</a>,
--   <a>pendingTaskCount_truncated</a> - If set to true, indicates that the
--   actual count was more than the maximum supported by this API and the
--   count returned is the truncated value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:PendingTaskCount'</a>, <a>pendingTaskCount_count</a> -
--   The number of tasks in the task list.
newPendingTaskCount :: Natural -> PendingTaskCount

-- | If set to true, indicates that the actual count was more than the
--   maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated
--   value.
pendingTaskCount_truncated :: Lens' PendingTaskCount (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of tasks in the task list.
pendingTaskCount_count :: Lens' PendingTaskCount Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.PendingTaskCount.PendingTaskCount


module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>RecordMarker</tt> decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordMarkerDecisionAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes

-- | The details of the marker.
[$sel:details:RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes'] :: RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the marker.
[$sel:markerName:RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes'] :: RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>recordMarkerDecisionAttributes_details</a> - The details of the
--   marker.
--   
--   <a>$sel:markerName:RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>recordMarkerDecisionAttributes_markerName</a> - The name of the
--   marker.
newRecordMarkerDecisionAttributes :: Text -> RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes

-- | The details of the marker.
recordMarkerDecisionAttributes_details :: Lens' RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the marker.
recordMarkerDecisionAttributes_markerName :: Lens' RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes.RecordMarkerDecisionAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>RecordMarkerFailed</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes
RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes' :: Text -> RecordMarkerFailedCause -> Integer -> RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes

-- | The marker's name.
[$sel:markerName:RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes'] :: RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The cause of the failure. This information is generated by the system
--   and can be useful for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:cause:RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes'] :: RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes -> RecordMarkerFailedCause

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>RecordMarkerFailed</tt>
--   decision for this cancellation request. This information can be useful
--   for diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up
--   to this event.
[$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes'] :: RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:markerName:RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>recordMarkerFailedEventAttributes_markerName</a> - The marker's
--   name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cause:RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>recordMarkerFailedEventAttributes_cause</a> - The cause of the
--   failure. This information is generated by the system and can be useful
--   for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>recordMarkerFailedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>RecordMarkerFailed</tt>
--   decision for this cancellation request. This information can be useful
--   for diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up
--   to this event.
newRecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes :: Text -> RecordMarkerFailedCause -> Integer -> RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes

-- | The marker's name.
recordMarkerFailedEventAttributes_markerName :: Lens' RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes Text

-- | The cause of the failure. This information is generated by the system
--   and can be useful for diagnostic purposes.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
recordMarkerFailedEventAttributes_cause :: Lens' RecordMarkerFailedEventAttributes RecordMarkerFailedCause

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>RecordMarkerFailed</tt>
--   decision for this cancellation request. This information can be useful

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.DomainInfo

-- | Contains general information about a domain.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainInfo</a> smart constructor.
data DomainInfo
DomainInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> RegistrationStatus -> DomainInfo

-- | The ARN of the domain.
[$sel:arn:DomainInfo'] :: DomainInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the domain provided through RegisterDomain.
[$sel:description:DomainInfo'] :: DomainInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the domain. This name is unique within the account.
[$sel:name:DomainInfo'] :: DomainInfo -> Text

-- | The status of the domain:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>  The domain is properly registered and
--   available. You can use this domain for registering types and creating
--   new workflow executions.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>  The domain was deprecated using
--   DeprecateDomain, but is still in use. You should not create new
--   workflow executions in this domain.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:status:DomainInfo'] :: DomainInfo -> RegistrationStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DomainInfo'</a>, <a>domainInfo_arn</a> - The ARN of the
--   domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:DomainInfo'</a>, <a>domainInfo_description</a> -
--   The description of the domain provided through RegisterDomain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DomainInfo'</a>, <a>domainInfo_name</a> - The name of the
--   domain. This name is unique within the account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DomainInfo'</a>, <a>domainInfo_status</a> - The status
--   of the domain:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>  The domain is properly registered and
--   available. You can use this domain for registering types and creating
--   new workflow executions.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>  The domain was deprecated using
--   DeprecateDomain, but is still in use. You should not create new
--   workflow executions in this domain.</li>
--   </ul>
newDomainInfo :: Text -> RegistrationStatus -> DomainInfo

-- | The ARN of the domain.
domainInfo_arn :: Lens' DomainInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the domain provided through RegisterDomain.
domainInfo_description :: Lens' DomainInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the domain. This name is unique within the account.
domainInfo_name :: Lens' DomainInfo Text

-- | The status of the domain:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>  The domain is properly registered and
--   available. You can use this domain for registering types and creating
--   new workflow executions.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>  The domain was deprecated using
--   DeprecateDomain, but is still in use. You should not create new
--   workflow executions in this domain.</li>
--   </ul>
domainInfo_status :: Lens' DomainInfo RegistrationStatus
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.DomainInfo.DomainInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.DomainInfo.DomainInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.DomainInfo.DomainInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.DomainInfo.DomainInfo

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ActivityTypeInfo

-- | Detailed information about an activity type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityTypeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data ActivityTypeInfo
ActivityTypeInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ActivityType -> RegistrationStatus -> POSIX -> ActivityTypeInfo

-- | If DEPRECATED, the date and time DeprecateActivityType was called.
[$sel:deprecationDate:ActivityTypeInfo'] :: ActivityTypeInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The description of the activity type provided in RegisterActivityType.
[$sel:description:ActivityTypeInfo'] :: ActivityTypeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The ActivityType type structure representing the activity type.
[$sel:activityType:ActivityTypeInfo'] :: ActivityTypeInfo -> ActivityType

-- | The current status of the activity type.
[$sel:status:ActivityTypeInfo'] :: ActivityTypeInfo -> RegistrationStatus

-- | The date and time this activity type was created through
--   RegisterActivityType.
[$sel:creationDate:ActivityTypeInfo'] :: ActivityTypeInfo -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityTypeInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   time DeprecateActivityType was called.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:ActivityTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>activityTypeInfo_description</a> - The description of the activity
--   type provided in RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activityType:ActivityTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>activityTypeInfo_activityType</a> - The ActivityType type structure
--   representing the activity type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ActivityTypeInfo'</a>, <a>activityTypeInfo_status</a> -
--   The current status of the activity type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:ActivityTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>activityTypeInfo_creationDate</a> - The date and time this activity
--   type was created through RegisterActivityType.
newActivityTypeInfo :: ActivityType -> RegistrationStatus -> UTCTime -> ActivityTypeInfo

-- | If DEPRECATED, the date and time DeprecateActivityType was called.
activityTypeInfo_deprecationDate :: Lens' ActivityTypeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The description of the activity type provided in RegisterActivityType.
activityTypeInfo_description :: Lens' ActivityTypeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The ActivityType type structure representing the activity type.
activityTypeInfo_activityType :: Lens' ActivityTypeInfo ActivityType

-- | The current status of the activity type.
activityTypeInfo_status :: Lens' ActivityTypeInfo RegistrationStatus

-- | The date and time this activity type was created through
--   RegisterActivityType.
activityTypeInfo_creationDate :: Lens' ActivityTypeInfo UTCTime

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ActivityTypeInfo.ActivityTypeInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ActivityTypeInfo.ActivityTypeInfo

--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>

--   <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.

--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.

--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiatedEventAttributes.RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiatedEventAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiatedEventAttributes.RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiatedEventAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiatedEventAttributes.RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiatedEventAttributes


module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag

-- | Tags are key-value pairs that can be associated with Amazon SWF state
--   machines and activities.
--   
--   Tags may only contain unicode letters, digits, whitespace, or these
--   symbols: <tt>_ . : / = + - @</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceTag</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceTag
ResourceTag' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> ResourceTag

-- | The value of a tag.
[$sel:value:ResourceTag'] :: ResourceTag -> Maybe Text

-- | The key of a tag.
[$sel:key:ResourceTag'] :: ResourceTag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceTag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:ResourceTag'</a>, <a>resourceTag_value</a> - The value
--   of a tag.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:ResourceTag'</a>, <a>resourceTag_key</a> - The key of a
--   tag.
newResourceTag :: Text -> ResourceTag

-- | The value of a tag.
resourceTag_value :: Lens' ResourceTag (Maybe Text)

-- | The key of a tag.
resourceTag_key :: Lens' ResourceTag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ResourceTag.ResourceTag

--   and can be useful for diagnostic purposes.

--   decision failed because it lacked sufficient permissions. For details
--   and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon
--   SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.

--   the decision that resulted in the scheduling of this activity task.

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes

-- | Decision attributes specified in
--   <tt>scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes</tt> within the list of
--   decisions <tt>decisions</tt> passed to RespondDecisionTaskCompleted.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes
ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes

-- | The optional input data to be supplied to the Lambda function.
[$sel:input:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The data attached to the event that the decider can use in subsequent
--   workflow tasks. This data isn't sent to the Lambda task.
[$sel:control:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The timeout value, in seconds, after which the Lambda function is
--   considered to be failed once it has started. This can be any integer
--   from 1-300 (1s-5m). If no value is supplied, than a default value of
--   300s is assumed.
[$sel:startToCloseTimeout:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | A string that identifies the Lambda function execution in the event
--   history.
[$sel:id:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | The name, or ARN, of the Lambda function to schedule.
[$sel:name:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_input</a> - The optional
--   input data to be supplied to the Lambda function.
--   
--   <a>$sel:control:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_control</a> - The data
--   attached to the event that the decider can use in subsequent workflow
--   tasks. This data isn't sent to the Lambda task.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:startToCloseTimeout:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_startToCloseTimeout</a> -
--   The timeout value, in seconds, after which the Lambda function is
--   considered to be failed once it has started. This can be any integer
--   from 1-300 (1s-5m). If no value is supplied, than a default value of
--   300s is assumed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_id</a> - A string that
--   identifies the Lambda function execution in the event history.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_name</a> - The name, or
--   ARN, of the Lambda function to schedule.
newScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes :: Text -> Text -> ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes

-- | The optional input data to be supplied to the Lambda function.
scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_input :: Lens' ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The data attached to the event that the decider can use in subsequent
--   workflow tasks. This data isn't sent to the Lambda task.
scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_control :: Lens' ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The timeout value, in seconds, after which the Lambda function is
--   considered to be failed once it has started. This can be any integer
--   from 1-300 (1s-5m). If no value is supplied, than a default value of
--   300s is assumed.
scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_startToCloseTimeout :: Lens' ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | A string that identifies the Lambda function execution in the event
--   history.
scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_id :: Lens' ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes Text

-- | The name, or ARN, of the Lambda function to schedule.
scheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes_name :: Lens' ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes.ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes.ScheduleLambdaFunctionDecisionAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i>
--   <a>newSignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | The <tt>runId</tt> of the workflow execution to be signaled.
[$sel:runId:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The input data to be provided with the signal. The target workflow
--   execution uses the signal name and input data to process the signal.
[$sel:input:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent decision tasks.
[$sel:control:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>workflowId</tt> of the workflow execution to be signaled.
[$sel:workflowId:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | The name of the signal.The target workflow execution uses the signal
--   name and input to process the signal.
[$sel:signalName:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:runId:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_runId</a> - The
--   <tt>runId</tt> of the workflow execution to be signaled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_input</a> - The
--   input data to be provided with the signal. The target workflow
--   execution uses the signal name and input data to process the signal.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:control:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_control</a> - The
--   data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent decision tasks.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowId:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_workflowId</a> -
--   The <tt>workflowId</tt> of the workflow execution to be signaled.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:signalName:SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_signalName</a> -
--   The name of the signal.The target workflow execution uses the signal
--   name and input to process the signal.
newSignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes :: Text -> Text -> SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | The <tt>runId</tt> of the workflow execution to be signaled.
signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_runId :: Lens' SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The input data to be provided with the signal. The target workflow
--   execution uses the signal name and input data to process the signal.
signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_input :: Lens' SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent decision tasks.
signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_control :: Lens' SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>workflowId</tt> of the workflow execution to be signaled.
signalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_workflowId :: Lens' SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes Text

--   name and input to process the signal.

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>StartLambdaFunctionFailed</tt> event.
--   It isn't set for other event types.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes
StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe StartLambdaFunctionFailedCause -> StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes

-- | A description that can help diagnose the cause of the fault.
[$sel:message:StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes'] :: StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>ActivityTaskScheduled</tt> event that was recorded
--   when this activity task was scheduled. To help diagnose issues, use
--   this information to trace back the chain of events leading up to this
--   event.
[$sel:scheduledEventId:StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes'] :: StartLambdaFunctionFailedEventAttributes -> Maybe Integer

-- | The cause of the failure. To help diagnose issues, use this
--   information to trace back the chain of events leading up to this
--   event.
--   
--   If <tt>cause</tt> is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>, the
--   decision failed because the IAM role attached to the execution lacked
--   sufficient permissions. For details and example IAM policies, see

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.StartTimerDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>StartTimer</tt> decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTimerDecisionAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data StartTimerDecisionAttributes
StartTimerDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> StartTimerDecisionAttributes

-- | The data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent workflow tasks.
[$sel:control:StartTimerDecisionAttributes'] :: StartTimerDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the timer.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not contain the literal string
--   <tt>arn</tt>.
[$sel:timerId:StartTimerDecisionAttributes'] :: StartTimerDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | The duration to wait before firing the timer.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>.
[$sel:startToFireTimeout:StartTimerDecisionAttributes'] :: StartTimerDecisionAttributes -> Text

--   optional fields omitted.

--   timer.
--

--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>Constrain the following parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt>
--   element with the appropriate keys.<ul><li><tt>activityType.name</tt> 
--   String constraint. The key is
--   <tt>swf:activityType.name</tt>.</li><li><tt>activityType.version</tt>
--    String constraint. The key is
--   <tt>swf:activityType.version</tt>.</li><li><tt>taskList</tt>  String
--   constraint. The key is <tt>swf:taskList.name</tt>.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes
ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ActivityType -> Text -> ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes

-- | The input provided to the activity task.
[$sel:input:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the maximum time before which a worker processing a
--   task of this type must report progress by calling
--   RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat. If the timeout is exceeded, the activity
--   task is automatically timed out. If the worker subsequently attempts
--   to record a heartbeat or returns a result, it is ignored. This
--   overrides the default heartbeat timeout specified when registering the
--   activity type using RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:heartbeatTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum duration for this activity task.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A schedule-to-close timeout for this activity task must be specified
--   either as a default for the activity type or through this field. If
--   neither this field is set nor a default schedule-to-close timeout was
--   specified at registration time then a fault is returned.
[$sel:scheduleToCloseTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the maximum duration the activity task can wait to
--   be assigned to a worker. This overrides the default schedule-to-start
--   timeout specified when registering the activity type using
--   RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A schedule-to-start timeout for this activity task must be specified
--   either as a default for the activity type or through this field. If
--   neither this field is set nor a default schedule-to-start timeout was
--   specified at registration time then a fault is returned.
[$sel:scheduleToStartTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the priority with which the activity task is to be
--   assigned to a worker. This overrides the defaultTaskPriority specified
--   when registering the activity type using RegisterActivityType. Valid
--   values are integers that range from Java's <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt>
--   (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt> (2147483647). Higher
--   numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:taskPriority:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the name of the task list in which to schedule the
--   activity task. If not specified, the <tt>defaultTaskList</tt>
--   registered with the activity type is used.
--   
--   A task list for this activity task must be specified either as a
--   default for the activity type or through this field. If neither this
--   field is set nor a default task list was specified at registration
--   time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not contain the literal string
--   <tt>arn</tt>.
[$sel:taskList:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe TaskList

-- | Data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent workflow tasks. This data isn't sent to the activity.
[$sel:control:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the maximum duration a worker may take to process
--   this activity task. This overrides the default start-to-close timeout
--   specified when registering the activity type using
--   RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A start-to-close timeout for this activity task must be specified
--   either as a default for the activity type or through this field. If
--   neither this field is set nor a default start-to-close timeout was
--   specified at registration time then a fault is returned.
[$sel:startToCloseTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the activity task to schedule.
[$sel:activityType:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> ActivityType

-- | The <tt>activityId</tt> of the activity task.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not contain the literal string
--   <tt>arn</tt>.
[$sel:activityId:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'] :: ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_input</a> - The input
--   provided to the activity task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:heartbeatTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_heartbeatTimeout</a> - If
--   set, specifies the maximum time before which a worker processing a
--   task of this type must report progress by calling
--   RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat. If the timeout is exceeded, the activity
--   task is automatically timed out. If the worker subsequently attempts
--   to record a heartbeat or returns a result, it is ignored. This
--   overrides the default heartbeat timeout specified when registering the
--   activity type using RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleToCloseTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_scheduleToCloseTimeout</a> -
--   The maximum duration for this activity task.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A schedule-to-close timeout for this activity task must be specified
--   either as a default for the activity type or through this field. If
--   neither this field is set nor a default schedule-to-close timeout was
--   specified at registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:scheduleToStartTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_scheduleToStartTimeout</a> -
--   If set, specifies the maximum duration the activity task can wait to
--   be assigned to a worker. This overrides the default schedule-to-start
--   timeout specified when registering the activity type using
--   RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A schedule-to-start timeout for this activity task must be specified
--   either as a default for the activity type or through this field. If
--   neither this field is set nor a default schedule-to-start timeout was
--   specified at registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_taskPriority</a> - If set,
--   specifies the priority with which the activity task is to be assigned
--   to a worker. This overrides the defaultTaskPriority specified when
--   registering the activity type using RegisterActivityType. Valid values
--   are integers that range from Java's <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt>
--   (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt> (2147483647). Higher
--   numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_taskList</a> - If set,
--   specifies the name of the task list in which to schedule the activity
--   task. If not specified, the <tt>defaultTaskList</tt> registered with
--   the activity type is used.
--   
--   A task list for this activity task must be specified either as a
--   default for the activity type or through this field. If neither this
--   field is set nor a default task list was specified at registration
--   time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not contain the literal string
--   <tt>arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:control:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_control</a> - Data attached
--   to the event that can be used by the decider in subsequent workflow
--   tasks. This data isn't sent to the activity.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:startToCloseTimeout:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_startToCloseTimeout</a> - If
--   set, specifies the maximum duration a worker may take to process this
--   activity task. This overrides the default start-to-close timeout
--   specified when registering the activity type using
--   RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A start-to-close timeout for this activity task must be specified
--   either as a default for the activity type or through this field. If
--   neither this field is set nor a default start-to-close timeout was
--   specified at registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activityType:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_activityType</a> - The type
--   of the activity task to schedule.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activityId:ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_activityId</a> - The
--   <tt>activityId</tt> of the activity task.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not contain the literal string
--   <tt>arn</tt>.
newScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes :: ActivityType -> Text -> ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes

-- | The input provided to the activity task.
scheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes_input :: Lens' ScheduleActivityTaskDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the maximum time before which a worker processing a
--   task of this type must report progress by calling
--   RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat. If the timeout is exceeded, the activity
--   task is automatically timed out. If the worker subsequently attempts

--   activity type using RegisterActivityType.

--   duration.

-- | The maximum duration for this activity task.

-- | If set, specifies the maximum duration the activity task can wait to

--   RegisterActivityType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal

--   duration.
--   
--   A schedule-to-start timeout for this activity task must be specified

--   values are integers that range from Java's <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt>

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this decision's access to Amazon
--   SWF resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>Constrain the following parameters by using a <tt>Condition</tt>
--   element with the appropriate keys.<ul><li><tt>tag</tt>  A tag used to
--   identify the workflow execution</li><li><tt>taskList</tt>  String
--   constraint. The key is
--   <tt>swf:taskList.name</tt>.</li><li><tt>workflowType.version</tt> 
--   String constraint. The key is
--   <tt>swf:workflowType.version</tt>.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a>
--   smart constructor.
data ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | The input provided to the new workflow execution.
[$sel:input:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role to attach to the new (continued) execution.
[$sel:lambdaRole:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the policy to use for the child workflow executions
--   of the new execution if it is terminated by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This policy overrides the default child policy specified when
--   registering the workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
[$sel:childPolicy:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe ChildPolicy

-- | The task priority that, if set, specifies the priority for the
--   decision tasks for this workflow execution. This overrides the
--   defaultTaskPriority specified when registering the workflow type.
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:taskPriority:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The task list to use for the decisions of the new (continued) workflow
--   execution.
[$sel:taskList:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe TaskList

-- | If set, specifies the total duration for this workflow execution. This
--   overrides the <tt>defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</tt> specified
--   when registering the workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   An execution start-to-close timeout for this workflow execution must
--   be specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   field. If neither this field is set nor a default execution
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
[$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The version of the workflow to start.
[$sel:workflowTypeVersion:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the maximum duration of decision tasks for the new workflow
--   execution. This parameter overrides the
--   <tt>defaultTaskStartToCloseTimout</tt> specified when registering the
--   workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A task start-to-close timeout for the new workflow execution must be
--   specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   parameter. If neither this parameter is set nor a default task
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
[$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags to associate with the new workflow execution. A
--   maximum of 5 tags can be specified. You can list workflow executions
--   with a specific tag by calling ListOpenWorkflowExecutions or
--   ListClosedWorkflowExecutions and specifying a TagFilter.
[$sel:tagList:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'] :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,

--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This policy overrides the default child policy specified when
--   registering the workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--

--   
--   <ul>

--   execution.
--   
--
