--   <a>continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - If set, specifies the total duration for this workflow execution.
--   This overrides the <tt>defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</tt>
--   specified when registering the workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   An execution start-to-close timeout for this workflow execution must
--   be specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   field. If neither this field is set nor a default execution
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowTypeVersion:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_workflowTypeVersion</a>
--   - The version of the workflow to start.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - Specifies the maximum duration of decision tasks for the new
--   workflow execution. This parameter overrides the
--   <tt>defaultTaskStartToCloseTimout</tt> specified when registering the
--   workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A task start-to-close timeout for the new workflow execution must be
--   specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   parameter. If neither this parameter is set nor a default task
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_tagList</a> - The
--   list of tags to associate with the new workflow execution. A maximum
--   of 5 tags can be specified. You can list workflow executions with a
--   specific tag by calling ListOpenWorkflowExecutions or
--   ListClosedWorkflowExecutions and specifying a TagFilter.
newContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes :: ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes

-- | The input provided to the new workflow execution.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_input :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role to attach to the new (continued) execution.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_lambdaRole :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the policy to use for the child workflow executions
--   of the new execution if it is terminated by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This policy overrides the default child policy specified when
--   registering the workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe ChildPolicy)

-- | The task priority that, if set, specifies the priority for the
--   decision tasks for this workflow execution. This overrides the
--   defaultTaskPriority specified when registering the workflow type.
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_taskPriority :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The task list to use for the decisions of the new (continued) workflow
--   execution.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_taskList :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe TaskList)

-- | If set, specifies the total duration for this workflow execution. This
--   overrides the <tt>defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</tt> specified
--   when registering the workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   An execution start-to-close timeout for this workflow execution must
--   be specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   field. If neither this field is set nor a default execution
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The version of the workflow to start.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_workflowTypeVersion :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | Specifies the maximum duration of decision tasks for the new workflow
--   execution. This parameter overrides the
--   <tt>defaultTaskStartToCloseTimout</tt> specified when registering the
--   workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A task start-to-close timeout for the new workflow execution must be
--   specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   parameter. If neither this parameter is set nor a default task
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags to associate with the new workflow execution. A
--   maximum of 5 tags can be specified. You can list workflow executions
--   with a specific tag by calling ListOpenWorkflowExecutions or
--   ListClosedWorkflowExecutions and specifying a TagFilter.
continueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes_tagList :: Lens' ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes (Maybe [Text])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes.ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecutionDecisionAttributes


module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ActivityTypeConfiguration

-- | Configuration settings registered with the activity type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityTypeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data ActivityTypeConfiguration
ActivityTypeConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ActivityTypeConfiguration

-- | The default task priority for tasks of this activity type, specified
--   at registration. If not set, then <tt>0</tt> is used as the default
--   priority. This default can be overridden when scheduling an activity
--   task.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:defaultTaskPriority:ActivityTypeConfiguration'] :: ActivityTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default task list specified for this activity type at
--   registration. This default is used if a task list isn't provided when
--   a task is scheduled through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt>
--   Decision. You can override the default registered task list when
--   scheduling a task through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
[$sel:defaultTaskList:ActivityTypeConfiguration'] :: ActivityTypeConfiguration -> Maybe TaskList

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the activity
--   type, that a task of an activity type can wait before being assigned
--   to a worker. You can override this default when scheduling a task
--   through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:defaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout:ActivityTypeConfiguration'] :: ActivityTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default maximum duration for tasks of an activity type specified
--   when registering the activity type. You can override this default when
--   scheduling a task through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout:ActivityTypeConfiguration'] :: ActivityTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the activity
--   type, for tasks of this activity type. You can override this default
--   when scheduling a task through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt>
--   Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:defaultTaskScheduleToCloseTimeout:ActivityTypeConfiguration'] :: ActivityTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default maximum time, in seconds, before which a worker processing
--   a task must report progress by calling RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat.
--   
--   You can specify this value only when <i>registering</i> an activity
--   type. The registered default value can be overridden when you schedule
--   a task through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision. If the
--   activity worker subsequently attempts to record a heartbeat or returns
--   a result, the activity worker receives an <tt>UnknownResource</tt>
--   fault. In this case, Amazon SWF no longer considers the activity task
--   to be valid; the activity worker should clean up the activity task.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:defaultTaskHeartbeatTimeout:ActivityTypeConfiguration'] :: ActivityTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityTypeConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskPriority:ActivityTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>activityTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskPriority</a> - The default
--   task priority for tasks of this activity type, specified at
--   registration. If not set, then <tt>0</tt> is used as the default
--   priority. This default can be overridden when scheduling an activity
--   task.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskList:ActivityTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>activityTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskList</a> - The default task
--   list specified for this activity type at registration. This default is
--   used if a task list isn't provided when a task is scheduled through
--   the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision. You can override the
--   default registered task list when scheduling a task through the
--   <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout:ActivityTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>activityTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout</a> -
--   The default maximum duration, specified when registering the activity
--   type, that a task of an activity type can wait before being assigned
--   to a worker. You can override this default when scheduling a task
--   through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--

--   type. The registered default value can be overridden when you schedule
--   a task through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision. If the
--   activity worker subsequently attempts to record a heartbeat or returns
--   a result, the activity worker receives an <tt>UnknownResource</tt>
--   fault. In this case, Amazon SWF no longer considers the activity task
--   to be valid; the activity worker should clean up the activity task.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
newActivityTypeConfiguration :: ActivityTypeConfiguration

-- | The default task priority for tasks of this activity type, specified
--   at registration. If not set, then <tt>0</tt> is used as the default
--   priority. This default can be overridden when scheduling an activity
--   task.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>ActivityTaskScheduled</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes
ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ActivityType -> Text -> TaskList -> Integer -> ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes

-- | The input provided to the activity task.
[$sel:input:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum time before which the worker processing this task must
--   report progress by calling RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat. If the timeout
--   is exceeded, the activity task is automatically timed out. If the
--   worker subsequently attempts to record a heartbeat or return a result,
--   it is ignored.
[$sel:heartbeatTimeout:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum amount of time for this activity task.
[$sel:scheduleToCloseTimeout:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum amount of time the activity task can wait to be assigned
--   to a worker.
[$sel:scheduleToStartTimeout:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The priority to assign to the scheduled activity task. If set, this
--   overrides any default priority value that was assigned when the
--   activity type was registered.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:taskPriority:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent workflow tasks. This data isn't sent to the activity.
[$sel:control:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum amount of time a worker may take to process the activity
--   task.
[$sel:startToCloseTimeout:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the activity task.
[$sel:activityType:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> ActivityType

-- | The unique ID of the activity task.
[$sel:activityId:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The task list in which the activity task has been scheduled.
[$sel:taskList:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> TaskList

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision that resulted in the scheduling of this activity task.
--   This information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back
--   the chain of events leading up to this event.
[$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes'] :: ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityTaskScheduledEventAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.TimerCanceledEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>TimerCanceled</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimerCanceledEventAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data TimerCanceledEventAttributes
TimerCanceledEventAttributes' :: Text -> Integer -> Integer -> TimerCanceledEventAttributes

-- | The unique ID of the timer that was canceled.
[$sel:timerId:TimerCanceledEventAttributes'] :: TimerCanceledEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>TimerStarted</tt> event that was recorded when this
--   timer was started. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
[$sel:startedEventId:TimerCanceledEventAttributes'] :: TimerCanceledEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>CancelTimer</tt> decision
--   to cancel this timer. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
[$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:TimerCanceledEventAttributes'] :: TimerCanceledEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TimerCanceledEventAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   timer that was canceled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedEventId:TimerCanceledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>timerCanceledEventAttributes_startedEventId</a> - The ID of the
--   <tt>TimerStarted</tt> event that was recorded when this timer was
--   started. This information can be useful for diagnosing problems by

--   cancel this timer. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
newTimerCanceledEventAttributes :: Text -> Integer -> Integer -> TimerCanceledEventAttributes

timerCanceledEventAttributes_timerId :: Lens' TimerCanceledEventAttributes Text

--   timer was started. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.TimerStartedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>TimerStarted</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTimerStartedEventAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data TimerStartedEventAttributes
TimerStartedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Integer -> TimerStartedEventAttributes

-- | Data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent workflow tasks.
[$sel:control:TimerStartedEventAttributes'] :: TimerStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique ID of the timer that was started.
[$sel:timerId:TimerStartedEventAttributes'] :: TimerStartedEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The duration of time after which the timer fires.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>.
[$sel:startToFireTimeout:TimerStartedEventAttributes'] :: TimerStartedEventAttributes -> Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>StartTimer</tt> decision
--   for this activity task. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
[$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:TimerStartedEventAttributes'] :: TimerStartedEventAttributes -> Integer

-- | Create a value of <a>TimerStartedEventAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   event that can be used by the decider in subsequent workflow tasks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timerId:TimerStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>timerStartedEventAttributes_timerId</a> - The unique ID of the
--   timer that was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startToFireTimeout:TimerStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>timerStartedEventAttributes_startToFireTimeout</a> - The duration
--   of time after which the timer fires.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:TimerStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>timerStartedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId</a> - The
--   ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to the
--   decision task that resulted in the <tt>StartTimer</tt> decision for
--   this activity task. This information can be useful for diagnosing
--   problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
newTimerStartedEventAttributes :: Text -> Text -> Integer -> TimerStartedEventAttributes

-- | Data attached to the event that can be used by the decider in
--   subsequent workflow tasks.
timerStartedEventAttributes_control :: Lens' TimerStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique ID of the timer that was started.
timerStartedEventAttributes_timerId :: Lens' TimerStartedEventAttributes Text

--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecution

-- | Represents a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecution</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecution
WorkflowExecution' :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowExecution

-- | The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.
[$sel:workflowId:WorkflowExecution'] :: WorkflowExecution -> Text

-- | A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.
[$sel:runId:WorkflowExecution'] :: WorkflowExecution -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecution</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   associated with the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:runId:WorkflowExecution'</a>, <a>workflowExecution_runId</a> -
--   A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.
newWorkflowExecution :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowExecution

-- | The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.
workflowExecution_workflowId :: Lens' WorkflowExecution Text

-- | A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.
workflowExecution_runId :: Lens' WorkflowExecution Text

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes</a>
--   smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedCause -> WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes

-- | The ID of the <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt>
--   event corresponding to the
--   <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecution</tt> decision to cancel
--   this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be found in
--   the history of the source workflow execution. This information can be
--   useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events
--   leading up to this event.
[$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes -> Maybe Integer

-- | The external workflow execution for which the cancellation was
--   requested.
[$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecution

-- | If set, indicates that the request to cancel the workflow execution
--   was automatically generated, and specifies the cause. This happens if
--   the parent workflow execution times out or is terminated, and the
--   child policy is set to cancel child executions.
[$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedCause

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the
--   <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision to cancel this workflow execution.The source event with this
--   ID can be found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution</a>
--   - The external workflow execution for which the cancellation was
--   requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes_cause</a> - If set,
--   indicates that the request to cancel the workflow execution was
--   automatically generated, and specifies the cause. This happens if the
--   parent workflow execution times out or is terminated, and the child
--   policy is set to cancel child executions.
newWorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes :: WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes

-- | The ID of the <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt>
--   event corresponding to the
--   <tt>RequestCancelExternalWorkflowExecution</tt> decision to cancel
--   this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be found in
--   the history of the source workflow execution. This information can be
--   useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events
--   leading up to this event.
workflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes (Maybe Integer)

-- | The external workflow execution for which the cancellation was
--   requested.
workflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | If set, indicates that the request to cancel the workflow execution
--   was automatically generated, and specifies the cause. This happens if
--   the parent workflow execution times out or is terminated, and the
--   child policy is set to cancel child executions.
workflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes_cause :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedCause)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionCancelRequestedEventAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration

-- | The configuration settings for a workflow execution including timeout
--   values, tasklist etc. These configuration settings are determined from
--   the defaults specified when registering the workflow type and those
--   specified when starting the workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
WorkflowExecutionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> TaskList -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionConfiguration

-- | The IAM role attached to the child workflow execution.
[$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'] :: WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The priority assigned to decision tasks for this workflow execution.
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'] :: WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum duration allowed for decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'] :: WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> Text

-- | The total duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'] :: WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> Text

-- | The task list used for the decision tasks generated for this workflow
--   execution.
[$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'] :: WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> TaskList

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'] :: WorkflowExecutionConfiguration -> ChildPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_lambdaRole</a> - The IAM role
--   attached to the child workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskPriority</a> - The priority
--   assigned to decision tasks for this workflow execution. Valid values
--   are integers that range from Java's <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt>
--   (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt> (2147483647). Higher
--   numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - The
--   maximum duration allowed for decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a> -
--   The total duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskList</a> - The task list used
--   for the decision tasks generated for this workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_childPolicy</a> - The policy to use
--   for the child workflow executions if this workflow execution is
--   terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution action
--   explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
newWorkflowExecutionConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> TaskList -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionConfiguration

-- | The IAM role attached to the child workflow execution.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_lambdaRole :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The priority assigned to decision tasks for this workflow execution.
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskPriority :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum duration allowed for decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration Text

-- | The total duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_executionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration Text

-- | The task list used for the decision tasks generated for this workflow
--   execution.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration TaskList

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionConfiguration_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration ChildPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration.WorkflowExecutionConfiguration


module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCount

-- | Contains the count of workflow executions returned from
--   CountOpenWorkflowExecutions or CountClosedWorkflowExecutions
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionCount</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionCount
WorkflowExecutionCount' :: Maybe Bool -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionCount

-- | If set to true, indicates that the actual count was more than the
--   maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated
--   value.
[$sel:truncated:WorkflowExecutionCount'] :: WorkflowExecutionCount -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of workflow executions.
[$sel:count:WorkflowExecutionCount'] :: WorkflowExecutionCount -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionCount</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:truncated:WorkflowExecutionCount'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCount_truncated</a> - If set to true, indicates
--   that the actual count was more than the maximum supported by this API
--   and the count returned is the truncated value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:WorkflowExecutionCount'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCount_count</a> - The number of workflow
--   executions.
newWorkflowExecutionCount :: Natural -> WorkflowExecutionCount

-- | If set to true, indicates that the actual count was more than the
--   maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated
--   value.
workflowExecutionCount_truncated :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCount (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of workflow executions.
workflowExecutionCount_count :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCount Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCount.WorkflowExecutionCount
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCount.WorkflowExecutionCount
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCount.WorkflowExecutionCount
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCount.WorkflowExecutionCount
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionCount.WorkflowExecutionCount

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | Contains the counts of open tasks, child workflow executions and
--   timers for a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | The count of Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
[$sel:openLambdaFunctions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Maybe Natural

-- | The count of activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
[$sel:openActivityTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | The count of decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution
--   can have at most one open decision task.
[$sel:openDecisionTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | The count of timers started by this workflow execution that have not
--   fired yet.
[$sel:openTimers:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | The count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
[$sel:openChildWorkflowExecutions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openLambdaFunctions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openLambdaFunctions</a> - The count of
--   Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openActivityTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openActivityTasks</a> - The count of
--   activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openDecisionTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openDecisionTasks</a> - The count of
--   decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution can have at
--   most one open decision task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openTimers:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openTimers</a> - The count of timers
--   started by this workflow execution that have not fired yet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openChildWorkflowExecutions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openChildWorkflowExecutions</a> - The
--   count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
newWorkflowExecutionOpenCounts :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | The count of Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openLambdaFunctions :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The count of activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openActivityTasks :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution
--   can have at most one open decision task.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openDecisionTasks :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of timers started by this workflow execution that have not
--   fired yet.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openTimers :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openChildWorkflowExecutions :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts.WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts


module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionSignaled</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Text -> WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | The inputs provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal
--   name and inputs to determine how to process the signal.
[$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
[$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Maybe Integer

-- | The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
[$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecution

-- | The name of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name
--   and inputs to determine how to the process the signal.
[$sel:signalName:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_input</a> - The inputs
--   provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal name and
--   inputs to determine how to process the signal.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt>
--   event corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution</a>
--   - The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signalName:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_signalName</a> - The name
--   of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name and inputs
--   to determine how to the process the signal.
newWorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes :: Text -> WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | The inputs provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal
--   name and inputs to determine how to process the signal.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_input :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe Integer)

-- | The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | The name of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name
--   and inputs to determine how to the process the signal.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_signalName :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes Text

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionTerminated</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | The details provided for the termination.
[$sel:details:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason provided for the termination.
[$sel:reason:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, indicates that the workflow execution was automatically
--   terminated, and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent
--   workflow execution times out or is terminated and the child policy is
--   set to terminate child executions.
[$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> ChildPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_details</a> - The
--   details provided for the termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_reason</a> - The reason
--   provided for the termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_cause</a> - If set,
--   indicates that the workflow execution was automatically terminated,
--   and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent workflow execution
--   times out or is terminated and the child policy is set to terminate
--   child executions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
newWorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes :: ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | The details provided for the termination.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_details :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason provided for the termination.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_reason :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, indicates that the workflow execution was automatically
--   terminated, and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent
--   workflow execution times out or is terminated and the child policy is
--   set to terminate child executions.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_cause :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause)

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes ChildPolicy
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes.WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

module Network.AWS.SWF.Types.WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionTimedOut</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes' :: WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | The type of timeout that caused this event.
[$sel:timeoutType:WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes -> WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes -> ChildPolicy

--   all optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_timeoutType</a> - The type
--   of timeout that caused this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>

workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_timeoutType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType

--   execution.
--

--
