--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowId:WorkflowExecutionFilter'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionFilter_workflowId</a> - The workflowId to pass of
--   match the criteria of this filter.
newWorkflowExecutionFilter :: Text -> WorkflowExecutionFilter

-- | The workflowId to pass of match the criteria of this filter.
workflowExecutionFilter_workflowId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionFilter Text

-- | Contains information about a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionInfo</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionInfo
WorkflowExecutionInfo' :: Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Maybe CloseStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Text] -> WorkflowExecution -> WorkflowType -> POSIX -> ExecutionStatus -> WorkflowExecutionInfo

-- | If this workflow execution is a child of another execution then
--   contains the workflow execution that started this execution.
[$sel:parent:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> Maybe WorkflowExecution

-- | If the execution status is closed then this specifies how the
--   execution was closed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>  the execution was successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCELED</tt>  the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows
--   the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is
--   closed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>  the execution was force terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  the execution failed to complete.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>  the execution did not complete in the alloted
--   time and was automatically timed out.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUED_AS_NEW</tt>  the execution is logically continued.
--   This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was
--   started to carry on the workflow.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:closeStatus:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> Maybe CloseStatus

-- | Set to true if a cancellation is requested for this workflow
--   execution.
[$sel:cancelRequested:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | The time when the workflow execution was closed. Set only if the
--   execution status is CLOSED.
[$sel:closeTimestamp:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The list of tags associated with the workflow execution. Tags can be
--   used to identify and list workflow executions of interest through the
--   visibility APIs. A workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
[$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The workflow execution this information is about.
[$sel:execution:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> WorkflowExecution

-- | The type of the workflow execution.
[$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> WorkflowType

-- | The time when the execution was started.
[$sel:startTimestamp:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> POSIX

-- | The current status of the execution.
[$sel:executionStatus:WorkflowExecutionInfo'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfo -> ExecutionStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parent:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_parent</a> - If this workflow execution is a
--   child of another execution then contains the workflow execution that
--   started this execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeStatus:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_closeStatus</a> - If the execution status is
--   closed then this specifies how the execution was closed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>  the execution was successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCELED</tt>  the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows
--   the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is
--   closed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>  the execution was force terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  the execution failed to complete.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>  the execution did not complete in the alloted
--   time and was automatically timed out.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUED_AS_NEW</tt>  the execution is logically continued.
--   This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was
--   started to carry on the workflow.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cancelRequested:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_cancelRequested</a> - Set to true if a
--   cancellation is requested for this workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeTimestamp:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_closeTimestamp</a> - The time when the
--   workflow execution was closed. Set only if the execution status is
--   CLOSED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_tagList</a> - The list of tags associated
--   with the workflow execution. Tags can be used to identify and list
--   workflow executions of interest through the visibility APIs. A
--   workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:execution:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_execution</a> - The workflow execution this
--   information is about.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_workflowType</a> - The type of the workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimestamp:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_startTimestamp</a> - The time when the
--   execution was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStatus:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_executionStatus</a> - The current status of
--   the execution.
newWorkflowExecutionInfo :: WorkflowExecution -> WorkflowType -> UTCTime -> ExecutionStatus -> WorkflowExecutionInfo

-- | If this workflow execution is a child of another execution then
--   contains the workflow execution that started this execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_parent :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | If the execution status is closed then this specifies how the
--   execution was closed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>  the execution was successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCELED</tt>  the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows
--   the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is
--   closed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>  the execution was force terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  the execution failed to complete.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>  the execution did not complete in the alloted
--   time and was automatically timed out.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUED_AS_NEW</tt>  the execution is logically continued.
--   This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was
--   started to carry on the workflow.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionInfo_closeStatus :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe CloseStatus)

-- | Set to true if a cancellation is requested for this workflow
--   execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_cancelRequested :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time when the workflow execution was closed. Set only if the
--   execution status is CLOSED.
workflowExecutionInfo_closeTimestamp :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The list of tags associated with the workflow execution. Tags can be
--   used to identify and list workflow executions of interest through the
--   visibility APIs. A workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
workflowExecutionInfo_tagList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The workflow execution this information is about.
workflowExecutionInfo_execution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo WorkflowExecution

-- | The type of the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo WorkflowType

-- | The time when the execution was started.
workflowExecutionInfo_startTimestamp :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo UTCTime

-- | The current status of the execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_executionStatus :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo ExecutionStatus

-- | Contains a paginated list of information about workflow executions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionInfos</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionInfos
WorkflowExecutionInfos' :: Maybe Text -> [WorkflowExecutionInfo] -> WorkflowExecutionInfos

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
[$sel:nextPageToken:WorkflowExecutionInfos'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfos -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of workflow information structures.
[$sel:executionInfos:WorkflowExecutionInfos'] :: WorkflowExecutionInfos -> [WorkflowExecutionInfo]

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionInfos</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:WorkflowExecutionInfos'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfos_nextPageToken</a> - If a
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are more
--   results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call
--   again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep all
--   other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionInfos:WorkflowExecutionInfos'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfos_executionInfos</a> - The list of workflow
--   information structures.
newWorkflowExecutionInfos :: WorkflowExecutionInfos

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
workflowExecutionInfos_nextPageToken :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfos (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of workflow information structures.
workflowExecutionInfos_executionInfos :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfos [WorkflowExecutionInfo]

-- | Contains the counts of open tasks, child workflow executions and
--   timers for a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | The count of Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
[$sel:openLambdaFunctions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Maybe Natural

-- | The count of activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
[$sel:openActivityTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | The count of decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution
--   can have at most one open decision task.
[$sel:openDecisionTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | The count of timers started by this workflow execution that have not
--   fired yet.
[$sel:openTimers:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | The count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
[$sel:openChildWorkflowExecutions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'] :: WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openLambdaFunctions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openLambdaFunctions</a> - The count of
--   Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openActivityTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openActivityTasks</a> - The count of
--   activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openDecisionTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openDecisionTasks</a> - The count of
--   decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution can have at
--   most one open decision task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openTimers:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openTimers</a> - The count of timers
--   started by this workflow execution that have not fired yet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openChildWorkflowExecutions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openChildWorkflowExecutions</a> - The
--   count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
newWorkflowExecutionOpenCounts :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | The count of Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openLambdaFunctions :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The count of activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openActivityTasks :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution
--   can have at most one open decision task.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openDecisionTasks :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of timers started by this workflow execution that have not
--   fired yet.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openTimers :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openChildWorkflowExecutions :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionSignaled</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Text -> WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | The inputs provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal
--   name and inputs to determine how to process the signal.
[$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
[$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Maybe Integer

-- | The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
[$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecution

-- | The name of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name
--   and inputs to determine how to the process the signal.
[$sel:signalName:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_input</a> - The inputs
--   provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal name and
--   inputs to determine how to process the signal.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt>
--   event corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution</a>
--   - The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signalName:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_signalName</a> - The name
--   of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name and inputs
--   to determine how to the process the signal.
newWorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes :: Text -> WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | The inputs provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal
--   name and inputs to determine how to process the signal.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_input :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe Integer)

-- | The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | The name of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name
--   and inputs to determine how to the process the signal.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_signalName :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes Text

-- | Provides details of <tt>WorkflowExecutionStarted</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> ChildPolicy -> TaskList -> WorkflowType -> WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes

-- | The input provided to the workflow execution.
[$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The IAM role attached to the workflow execution.
[$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If this workflow execution was started due to a
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision, then it contains the
--   <tt>runId</tt> of the previous workflow execution that was closed and
--   continued as this execution.
[$sel:continuedExecutionRunId:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision to
--   start this workflow execution. The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event.
[$sel:parentInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Integer

-- | The priority of the decision tasks in the workflow execution.
[$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum duration of decision tasks for this workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The list of tags associated with this workflow execution. An execution
--   can have up to 5 tags.
[$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The source workflow execution that started this workflow execution.
--   The member isn't set if the workflow execution was not started by a
--   workflow.
[$sel:parentWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecution

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> ChildPolicy

-- | The name of the task list for scheduling the decision tasks for this
--   workflow execution.
[$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> TaskList

-- | The workflow type of this execution.
[$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes -> WorkflowType

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_input</a> - The input
--   provided to the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_lambdaRole</a> - The IAM
--   role attached to the workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:continuedExecutionRunId:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_continuedExecutionRunId</a>
--   - If this workflow execution was started due to a
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision, then it contains the
--   <tt>runId</tt> of the previous workflow execution that was closed and
--   continued as this execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentInitiatedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision to
--   start this workflow execution. The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskPriority</a> - The
--   priority of the decision tasks in the workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - The maximum duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - The maximum duration of decision tasks for this workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_tagList</a> - The list of
--   tags associated with this workflow execution. An execution can have up
--   to 5 tags.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentWorkflowExecution</a>
--   - The source workflow execution that started this workflow execution.
--   The member isn't set if the workflow execution was not started by a
--   workflow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskList</a> - The name of
--   the task list for scheduling the decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_workflowType</a> - The
--   workflow type of this execution.
newWorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes :: ChildPolicy -> TaskList -> WorkflowType -> WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes

-- | The input provided to the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_input :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role attached to the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_lambdaRole :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If this workflow execution was started due to a
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision, then it contains the
--   <tt>runId</tt> of the previous workflow execution that was closed and
--   continued as this execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_continuedExecutionRunId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision to
--   start this workflow execution. The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentInitiatedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Integer)

-- | The priority of the decision tasks in the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskPriority :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum duration of decision tasks for this workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags associated with this workflow execution. An execution
--   can have up to 5 tags.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_tagList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | The source workflow execution that started this workflow execution.
--   The member isn't set if the workflow execution was not started by a
--   workflow.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentWorkflowExecution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes ChildPolicy

-- | The name of the task list for scheduling the decision tasks for this
--   workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes TaskList

-- | The workflow type of this execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes WorkflowType

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionTerminated</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | The details provided for the termination.
[$sel:details:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The reason provided for the termination.
[$sel:reason:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, indicates that the workflow execution was automatically
--   terminated, and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent
--   workflow execution times out or is terminated and the child policy is
--   set to terminate child executions.
[$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes -> ChildPolicy

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_details</a> - The
--   details provided for the termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_reason</a> - The reason
--   provided for the termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_cause</a> - If set,
--   indicates that the workflow execution was automatically terminated,
--   and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent workflow execution
--   times out or is terminated and the child policy is set to terminate
--   child executions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
newWorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes :: ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | The details provided for the termination.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_details :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason provided for the termination.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_reason :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, indicates that the workflow execution was automatically
--   terminated, and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent
--   workflow execution times out or is terminated and the child policy is
--   set to terminate child executions.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_cause :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause)

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>

--   execution history with this event.</li>

workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes ChildPolicy

data WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | The type of timeout that caused this event.
[$sel:timeoutType:WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes'] :: WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes -> WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType

--   execution.
--

--

-- | Represents a workflow type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowType</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowType
WorkflowType' :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowType

-- | The name of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
[$sel:name:WorkflowType'] :: WorkflowType -> Text

-- | The version of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
[$sel:version:WorkflowType'] :: WorkflowType -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkflowType'</a>, <a>workflowType_name</a> - The name of
--   the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:WorkflowType'</a>, <a>workflowType_version</a> - The
--   version of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
newWorkflowType :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowType

-- | The name of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
workflowType_name :: Lens' WorkflowType Text

-- | The version of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
workflowType_version :: Lens' WorkflowType Text

-- | The configuration settings of a workflow type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowTypeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowTypeConfiguration
WorkflowTypeConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> WorkflowTypeConfiguration

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for executions of this workflow type. This default can be
--   overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'] :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default task priority, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for all decision tasks of this workflow type. This default can
--   be overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:defaultTaskPriority:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'] :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default task list, specified when registering the workflow type,
--   for decisions tasks scheduled for workflow executions of this type.
--   This default can be overridden when starting a workflow execution
--   using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
[$sel:defaultTaskList:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'] :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration -> Maybe TaskList

-- | The default policy to use for the child workflow executions when a
--   workflow execution of this type is terminated, by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This default can be overridden when starting a workflow
--   execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:defaultChildPolicy:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'] :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration -> Maybe ChildPolicy

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, that a decision task for executions of this workflow type might
--   take before returning completion or failure. If the task doesn'tdo
--   close in the specified time then the task is automatically timed out
--   and rescheduled. If the decider eventually reports a completion or
--   failure, it is ignored. This default can be overridden when starting a
--   workflow execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
[$sel:defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'] :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | The default IAM role attached to this workflow type.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't specify an IAM role when starting this
--   workflow type, the default Lambda role is attached to the execution.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:defaultLambdaRole:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'] :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowTypeConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</a> -
--   The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for executions of this workflow type. This default can be
--   overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskPriority:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskPriority</a> - The default
--   task priority, specified when registering the workflow type, for all
--   decision tasks of this workflow type. This default can be overridden
--   when starting a workflow execution using the StartWorkflowExecution
--   action or the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskList:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskList</a> - The default task
--   list, specified when registering the workflow type, for decisions
--   tasks scheduled for workflow executions of this type. This default can
--   be overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultChildPolicy:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultChildPolicy</a> - The default
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions when a workflow

--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - The
--   default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, that a decision task for executions of this workflow type might
--   take before returning completion or failure. If the task doesn'tdo
--   close in the specified time then the task is automatically timed out
--   and rescheduled. If the decider eventually reports a completion or
--   failure, it is ignored. This default can be overridden when starting a
--   workflow execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultLambdaRole:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultLambdaRole</a> - The default IAM
--   role attached to this workflow type.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't specify an IAM role when starting this
--   workflow type, the default Lambda role is attached to the execution.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
newWorkflowTypeConfiguration :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for executions of this workflow type. This default can be
--   overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The default task priority, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for all decision tasks of this workflow type. This default can
--   be overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskPriority :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The default task list, specified when registering the workflow type,
--   for decisions tasks scheduled for workflow executions of this type.
--   This default can be overridden when starting a workflow execution
--   using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskList :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe TaskList)

-- | The default policy to use for the child workflow executions when a
--   workflow execution of this type is terminated, by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This default can be overridden when starting a workflow
--   execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultChildPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe ChildPolicy)

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, that a decision task for executions of this workflow type might
--   take before returning completion or failure. If the task doesn'tdo
--   close in the specified time then the task is automatically timed out

--   failure, it is ignored. This default can be overridden when starting a

--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited

-- | The default IAM role attached to this workflow type.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't specify an IAM role when starting this
--   workflow type, the default Lambda role is attached to the execution.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultLambdaRole :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Used to filter workflow execution query results by type. Each
--   parameter, if specified, defines a rule that must be satisfied by each
--   returned result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowTypeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowTypeFilter
WorkflowTypeFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WorkflowTypeFilter

-- | Version of the workflow type.
[$sel:version:WorkflowTypeFilter'] :: WorkflowTypeFilter -> Maybe Text

-- | Name of the workflow type.
[$sel:name:WorkflowTypeFilter'] :: WorkflowTypeFilter -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowTypeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:WorkflowTypeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeFilter_version</a> - Version of the workflow type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkflowTypeFilter'</a>, <a>workflowTypeFilter_name</a> -
--   Name of the workflow type.
newWorkflowTypeFilter :: Text -> WorkflowTypeFilter

-- | Version of the workflow type.
workflowTypeFilter_version :: Lens' WorkflowTypeFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the workflow type.
workflowTypeFilter_name :: Lens' WorkflowTypeFilter Text

-- | Contains information about a workflow type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowTypeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowTypeInfo
WorkflowTypeInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> WorkflowType -> RegistrationStatus -> POSIX -> WorkflowTypeInfo

-- | If the type is in deprecated state, then it is set to the date when
--   the type was deprecated.
[$sel:deprecationDate:WorkflowTypeInfo'] :: WorkflowTypeInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The description of the type registered through RegisterWorkflowType.
[$sel:description:WorkflowTypeInfo'] :: WorkflowTypeInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The workflow type this information is about.
[$sel:workflowType:WorkflowTypeInfo'] :: WorkflowTypeInfo -> WorkflowType

-- | The current status of the workflow type.
[$sel:status:WorkflowTypeInfo'] :: WorkflowTypeInfo -> RegistrationStatus

-- | The date when this type was registered.
[$sel:creationDate:WorkflowTypeInfo'] :: WorkflowTypeInfo -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowTypeInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deprecationDate:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_deprecationDate</a> - If the type is in deprecated
--   state, then it is set to the date when the type was deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_description</a> - The description of the type
--   registered through RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_workflowType</a> - The workflow type this
--   information is about.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>, <a>workflowTypeInfo_status</a> -
--   The current status of the workflow type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_creationDate</a> - The date when this type was
--   registered.
newWorkflowTypeInfo :: WorkflowType -> RegistrationStatus -> UTCTime -> WorkflowTypeInfo

-- | If the type is in deprecated state, then it is set to the date when
--   the type was deprecated.
workflowTypeInfo_deprecationDate :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The description of the type registered through RegisterWorkflowType.
workflowTypeInfo_description :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The workflow type this information is about.
workflowTypeInfo_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo WorkflowType

-- | The current status of the workflow type.
workflowTypeInfo_status :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo RegistrationStatus

-- | The date when this type was registered.
workflowTypeInfo_creationDate :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo UTCTime


-- | Records a <tt>WorkflowExecutionTerminated</tt> event and forces
--   closure of the workflow execution identified by the given domain,
--   runId, and workflowId. The child policy, registered with the workflow
--   type or specified when starting this execution, is applied to any open
--   child workflow executions of this workflow execution.
--   
--   If the identified workflow execution was in progress, it is terminated
--   immediately.
--   
--   If a runId isn't specified, then the
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionTerminated</tt> event is recorded in the history
--   of the current open workflow with the matching workflowId in the
--   domain.
--   
--   You should consider using RequestCancelWorkflowExecution action
--   instead because it allows the workflow to gracefully close while
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution doesn't.
--   
--   <b>Access Control</b>
--   
--   You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF
--   resources as follows:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Use a <tt>Resource</tt> element with the domain name to limit the
--   action to only specified domains.</li>
--   <li>Use an <tt>Action</tt> element to allow or deny permission to call
--   this action.</li>
--   <li>You cannot use an IAM policy to constrain this action's
--   parameters.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the
--   action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified
--   constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's
--   <tt>cause</tt> parameter is set to <tt>OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED</tt>.
--   For details and example IAM policies, see <a>Using IAM to Manage
--   Access to Amazon SWF Workflows</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.SWF.TerminateWorkflowExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTerminateWorkflowExecution</a> smart constructor.
data TerminateWorkflowExecution
TerminateWorkflowExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> TerminateWorkflowExecution

-- | The runId of the workflow execution to terminate.
[$sel:runId:TerminateWorkflowExecution'] :: TerminateWorkflowExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | If set, specifies the policy to use for the child workflow executions
--   of the workflow execution being terminated. This policy overrides the
--   child policy specified for the workflow execution at registration time
--   or when starting the execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
[$sel:childPolicy:TerminateWorkflowExecution'] :: TerminateWorkflowExecution -> Maybe ChildPolicy

-- | Details for terminating the workflow execution.
[$sel:details:TerminateWorkflowExecution'] :: TerminateWorkflowExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | A descriptive reason for terminating the workflow execution.
[$sel:reason:TerminateWorkflowExecution'] :: TerminateWorkflowExecution -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain of the workflow execution to terminate.
[$sel:domain:TerminateWorkflowExecution'] :: TerminateWorkflowExecution -> Text

-- | The workflowId of the workflow execution to terminate.
[$sel:workflowId:TerminateWorkflowExecution'] :: TerminateWorkflowExecution -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TerminateWorkflowExecution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:runId:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_runId</a> - The runId of the workflow
--   execution to terminate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_childPolicy</a> - If set, specifies the
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions of the workflow
--   execution being terminated. This policy overrides the child policy
--   specified for the workflow execution at registration time or when
--   starting the execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_details</a> - Details for terminating
--   the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_reason</a> - A descriptive reason for
--   terminating the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_domain</a> - The domain of the workflow
--   execution to terminate.

--   <a>$sel:workflowId:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_workflowId</a> - The workflowId of the
--   workflow execution to terminate.
newTerminateWorkflowExecution :: Text -> Text -> TerminateWorkflowExecution

-- | The runId of the workflow execution to terminate.
terminateWorkflowExecution_runId :: Lens' TerminateWorkflowExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, specifies the policy to use for the child workflow executions
--   of the workflow execution being terminated. This policy overrides the
--   child policy specified for the workflow execution at registration time
--   or when starting the execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
terminateWorkflowExecution_childPolicy :: Lens' TerminateWorkflowExecution (Maybe ChildPolicy)

-- | Details for terminating the workflow execution.
terminateWorkflowExecution_details :: Lens' TerminateWorkflowExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | A descriptive reason for terminating the workflow execution.
terminateWorkflowExecution_reason :: Lens' TerminateWorkflowExecution (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain of the workflow execution to terminate.

-- | Add a tag to a Amazon SWF domain.
--   
--   Amazon SWF supports a maximum of 50 tags per resource.
module Network.AWS.SWF.TagResource

--

--   symbols: <tt>_ . : / = + - @</tt>.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> [ResourceTag]
