-- | The maximum duration allowed for decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration Text

-- | The total duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_executionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration Text

-- | The task list used for the decision tasks generated for this workflow
--   execution.
workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration TaskList

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionConfiguration_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionConfiguration ChildPolicy

-- | The input provided to the new workflow execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_input :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role to attach to the new (continued) workflow execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_lambdaRole :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The priority of the task to use for the decisions of the new
--   (continued) workflow execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_taskPriority :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The total duration allowed for the new workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum duration of decision tasks for the new workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags associated with the new workflow execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_tagList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision that started this
--   execution. This information can be useful for diagnosing problems by
--   tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes Integer

-- | The <tt>runId</tt> of the new workflow execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_newExecutionRunId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes Text

-- | The task list to use for the decisions of the new (continued) workflow
--   execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_taskList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes TaskList

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions of the new
--   execution if it is terminated by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes ChildPolicy

-- | The workflow type of this execution.
workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes WorkflowType

-- | If set to true, indicates that the actual count was more than the
--   maximum supported by this API and the count returned is the truncated
--   value.
workflowExecutionCount_truncated :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCount (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of workflow executions.
workflowExecutionCount_count :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionCount Natural

-- | The details of the failure.
workflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_details :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The descriptive reason provided for the failure.
workflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_reason :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the <tt>FailWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   decision to fail this execution. This information can be useful for
--   diagnosing problems by tracing back the chain of events leading up to
--   this event.
workflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionFailedEventAttributes Integer

-- | The workflowId to pass of match the criteria of this filter.
workflowExecutionFilter_workflowId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionFilter Text

-- | If this workflow execution is a child of another execution then
--   contains the workflow execution that started this execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_parent :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | If the execution status is closed then this specifies how the
--   execution was closed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>  the execution was successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCELED</tt>  the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows
--   the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is
--   closed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>  the execution was force terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  the execution failed to complete.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>  the execution did not complete in the alloted
--   time and was automatically timed out.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUED_AS_NEW</tt>  the execution is logically continued.
--   This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was
--   started to carry on the workflow.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionInfo_closeStatus :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe CloseStatus)

-- | Set to true if a cancellation is requested for this workflow
--   execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_cancelRequested :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe Bool)

-- | The time when the workflow execution was closed. Set only if the
--   execution status is CLOSED.
workflowExecutionInfo_closeTimestamp :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The list of tags associated with the workflow execution. Tags can be
--   used to identify and list workflow executions of interest through the
--   visibility APIs. A workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
workflowExecutionInfo_tagList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The workflow execution this information is about.
workflowExecutionInfo_execution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo WorkflowExecution

-- | The type of the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo WorkflowType

-- | The time when the execution was started.
workflowExecutionInfo_startTimestamp :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo UTCTime

-- | The current status of the execution.
workflowExecutionInfo_executionStatus :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfo ExecutionStatus

-- | If a <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are
--   more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the
--   call again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep
--   all other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
workflowExecutionInfos_nextPageToken :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfos (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of workflow information structures.
workflowExecutionInfos_executionInfos :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionInfos [WorkflowExecutionInfo]

-- | The count of Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openLambdaFunctions :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts (Maybe Natural)

-- | The count of activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openActivityTasks :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution
--   can have at most one open decision task.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openDecisionTasks :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of timers started by this workflow execution that have not
--   fired yet.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openTimers :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openChildWorkflowExecutions :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts Natural

-- | The inputs provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal
--   name and inputs to determine how to process the signal.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_input :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe Integer)

-- | The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | The name of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name
--   and inputs to determine how to the process the signal.
workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_signalName :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes Text

-- | The input provided to the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_input :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The IAM role attached to the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_lambdaRole :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If this workflow execution was started due to a
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision, then it contains the
--   <tt>runId</tt> of the previous workflow execution that was closed and
--   continued as this execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_continuedExecutionRunId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision to
--   start this workflow execution. The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentInitiatedEventId :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Integer)

-- | The priority of the decision tasks in the workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskPriority :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum duration of decision tasks for this workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The list of tags associated with this workflow execution. An execution
--   can have up to 5 tags.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_tagList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe [Text])

-- | The source workflow execution that started this workflow execution.
--   The member isn't set if the workflow execution was not started by a
--   workflow.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentWorkflowExecution :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecution)

-- | The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes ChildPolicy

-- | The name of the task list for scheduling the decision tasks for this
--   workflow execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskList :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes TaskList

-- | The workflow type of this execution.
workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes WorkflowType

-- | The details provided for the termination.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_details :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The reason provided for the termination.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_reason :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | If set, indicates that the workflow execution was automatically
--   terminated, and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent
--   workflow execution times out or is terminated and the child policy is
--   set to terminate child executions.
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_cause :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes (Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause)

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes ChildPolicy

-- | The type of timeout that caused this event.
workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_timeoutType :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType

-- | The policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_childPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes ChildPolicy

-- | The name of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
workflowType_name :: Lens' WorkflowType Text

-- | The version of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
workflowType_version :: Lens' WorkflowType Text

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for executions of this workflow type. This default can be
--   overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The default task priority, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for all decision tasks of this workflow type. This default can
--   be overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskPriority :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The default task list, specified when registering the workflow type,
--   for decisions tasks scheduled for workflow executions of this type.
--   This default can be overridden when starting a workflow execution
--   using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskList :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe TaskList)

-- | The default policy to use for the child workflow executions when a
--   workflow execution of this type is terminated, by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This default can be overridden when starting a workflow
--   execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultChildPolicy :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe ChildPolicy)

-- | The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, that a decision task for executions of this workflow type might
--   take before returning completion or failure. If the task doesn'tdo
--   close in the specified time then the task is automatically timed out
--   and rescheduled. If the decider eventually reports a completion or
--   failure, it is ignored. This default can be overridden when starting a
--   workflow execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | The default IAM role attached to this workflow type.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't specify an IAM role when starting this
--   workflow type, the default Lambda role is attached to the execution.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultLambdaRole :: Lens' WorkflowTypeConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Version of the workflow type.
workflowTypeFilter_version :: Lens' WorkflowTypeFilter (Maybe Text)

-- | Name of the workflow type.
workflowTypeFilter_name :: Lens' WorkflowTypeFilter Text

-- | If the type is in deprecated state, then it is set to the date when
--   the type was deprecated.
workflowTypeInfo_deprecationDate :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The description of the type registered through RegisterWorkflowType.
workflowTypeInfo_description :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The workflow type this information is about.
workflowTypeInfo_workflowType :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo WorkflowType

-- | The current status of the workflow type.
workflowTypeInfo_status :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo RegistrationStatus

-- | The date when this type was registered.
workflowTypeInfo_creationDate :: Lens' WorkflowTypeInfo UTCTime


module Network.AWS.SWF.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2012-01-25</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Simple Workflow Service
--   
--   The Amazon Simple Workflow Service (Amazon SWF) makes it easy to build
--   applications that use Amazon's cloud to coordinate work across
--   distributed components. In Amazon SWF, a <i>task</i> represents a
--   logical unit of work that is performed by a component of your
--   workflow. Coordinating tasks in a workflow involves managing intertask
--   dependencies, scheduling, and concurrency in accordance with the
--   logical flow of the application.
--   
--   Amazon SWF gives you full control over implementing tasks and
--   coordinating them without worrying about underlying complexities such
--   as tracking their progress and maintaining their state.
--   
--   This documentation serves as reference only. For a broader overview of
--   the Amazon SWF programming model, see the
--   <i>&lt;https:</i><i>docs.aws.amazon.com</i>amazonswf<i>latest</i>developerguide<i>
--   Amazon SWF Developer Guide&gt;</i> .
module Network.AWS.SWF

-- | API version <tt>2012-01-25</tt> of the Amazon Simple Workflow Service
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Returned if the domain already exists. You may get this fault if you
--   are registering a domain that is either already registered or
--   deprecated, or if you undeprecate a domain that is currently
--   registered.
_DomainAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned by StartWorkflowExecution when an open execution with the
--   same workflowId is already running in the specified domain.
_WorkflowExecutionAlreadyStartedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned by any operation if a system imposed limitation has been
--   reached. To address this fault you should either clean up unused
--   resources or increase the limit by contacting AWS.
_LimitExceededFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned when the specified domain has been deprecated.
_DomainDeprecatedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned when the named resource cannot be found with in the scope of
--   this operation (region or domain). This could happen if the named
--   resource was never created or is no longer available for this
--   operation.
_UnknownResourceFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned when the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke
--   the action.
_OperationNotPermittedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned if the type already exists in the specified domain. You may
--   get this fault if you are registering a type that is either already
--   registered or deprecated, or if you undeprecate a type that is
--   currently registered.
_TypeAlreadyExistsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've exceeded the number of tags allowed for a domain.
_TooManyTagsFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Returned when the specified activity or workflow type was already
--   deprecated.
_TypeDeprecatedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The <tt>StartWorkflowExecution</tt> API action was called without the
--   required parameters set.
--   
--   Some workflow execution parameters, such as the decision
--   <tt>taskList</tt>, must be set to start the execution. However, these
--   parameters might have been set as defaults when the workflow type was
--   registered. In this case, you can omit these parameters from the
--   <tt>StartWorkflowExecution</tt> call and Amazon SWF uses the values
--   defined in the workflow type.
--   
--   If these parameters aren't set and no default parameters were defined
--   in the workflow type, this error is displayed.
_DefaultUndefinedFault :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSignalWorkflowExecution</a> smart constructor.
data SignalWorkflowExecution
SignalWorkflowExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SignalWorkflowExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>SignalWorkflowExecution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:runId:SignalWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>signalWorkflowExecution_runId</a> - The runId of the workflow
--   execution to signal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:SignalWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>signalWorkflowExecution_input</a> - Data to attach to the
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionSignaled</tt> event in the target workflow
--   execution's history.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:SignalWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>signalWorkflowExecution_domain</a> - The name of the domain
--   containing the workflow execution to signal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowId:SignalWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>signalWorkflowExecution_workflowId</a> - The workflowId of the
--   workflow execution to signal.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signalName:SignalWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>signalWorkflowExecution_signalName</a> - The name of the signal.
--   This name must be meaningful to the target workflow.
newSignalWorkflowExecution :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SignalWorkflowExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSignalWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SignalWorkflowExecutionResponse
SignalWorkflowExecutionResponse' :: SignalWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>SignalWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newSignalWorkflowExecutionResponse :: SignalWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeWorkflowExecution</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeWorkflowExecution
DescribeWorkflowExecution' :: Text -> WorkflowExecution -> DescribeWorkflowExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeWorkflowExecution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:DescribeWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>describeWorkflowExecution_domain</a> - The name of the domain
--   containing the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:execution:DescribeWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>describeWorkflowExecution_execution</a> - The workflow execution to
--   describe.
newDescribeWorkflowExecution :: Text -> WorkflowExecution -> DescribeWorkflowExecution

-- | Contains details about a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DescribeWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterActivityType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskPriority:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_defaultTaskPriority</a> - The default task
--   priority to assign to the activity type. If not assigned, then
--   <tt>0</tt> is used. Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>in the </i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide<i>.</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskList:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_defaultTaskList</a> - If set, specifies the
--   default task list to use for scheduling tasks of this activity type.
--   This default task list is used if a task list isn't provided when a
--   task is scheduled through the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_description</a> - A textual description of the
--   activity type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_defaultTaskScheduleToStartTimeout</a> - If
--   set, specifies the default maximum duration that a task of this
--   activity type can wait before being assigned to a worker. This default
--   can be overridden when scheduling an activity task using the
--   <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - If set,
--   specifies the default maximum duration that a worker can take to
--   process tasks of this activity type. This default can be overridden
--   when scheduling an activity task using the
--   <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskScheduleToCloseTimeout:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_defaultTaskScheduleToCloseTimeout</a> - If
--   set, specifies the default maximum duration for a task of this
--   activity type. This default can be overridden when scheduling an
--   activity task using the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskHeartbeatTimeout:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_defaultTaskHeartbeatTimeout</a> - If set,
--   specifies the default maximum time before which a worker processing a
--   task of this type must report progress by calling
--   RecordActivityTaskHeartbeat. If the timeout is exceeded, the activity
--   task is automatically timed out. This default can be overridden when
--   scheduling an activity task using the <tt>ScheduleActivityTask</tt>
--   Decision. If the activity worker subsequently attempts to record a
--   heartbeat or returns a result, the activity worker receives an
--   <tt>UnknownResource</tt> fault. In this case, Amazon SWF no longer
--   considers the activity task to be valid; the activity worker should
--   clean up the activity task.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_domain</a> - The name of the domain in which
--   this activity is to be registered.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_name</a> - The name of the activity type
--   within the domain.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:RegisterActivityType'</a>,
--   <a>registerActivityType_version</a> - The version of the activity
--   type.
--   
--   The activity type consists of the name and version, the combination of
--   which must be unique within the domain.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
newRegisterActivityType :: Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterActivityType

--

--   are mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a
--   request.

--   each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve
--   the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination
--   token expires after 60 seconds. Using an expired pagination token will
--   return a <tt>400</tt> error: "<tt>Specified token has exceeded its
--   maximum lifetime</tt>".

--   can be returned in a single call.

--   results are returned in descending order of the start time of the
--   executions.
--

--   <a>listOpenWorkflowExecutions_executionFilter</a> - If specified, only
--   workflow executions matching the workflow ID specified in the filter
--   are returned.
--

--   are mutually exclusive. You can specify at most one of these in a
--   request.
--

--   contains the workflow executions to list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeFilter:ListOpenWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listOpenWorkflowExecutions_startTimeFilter</a> - Workflow
--   executions are included in the returned results based on whether their
--   start times are within the range specified by this filter.

--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RegisterDomain'</a>, <a>registerDomain_tags</a> - Tags to
--   be added when registering a domain.
--   
--   Tags may only contain unicode letters, digits, whitespace, or these
--   symbols: <tt>_ . : / = + - @</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RegisterDomain'</a>,
--   <a>registerDomain_description</a> - A text description of the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RegisterDomain'</a>, <a>registerDomain_name</a> - Name of
--   the domain to register. The name must be unique in the region that the
--   domain is registered in.
--

--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
--

--   <a>registerDomain_workflowExecutionRetentionPeriodInDays</a> - The
--   duration (in days) that records and histories of workflow executions
--   on the domain should be kept by the service. After the retention
--   period, the workflow execution isn't available in the results of
--   visibility calls.
--   
--   If you pass the value <tt>NONE</tt> or <tt>0</tt> (zero), then the
--   workflow execution history isn't retained. As soon as the workflow
--   execution completes, the execution record and its history are deleted.
--   
--   The maximum workflow execution retention period is 90 days. For more
--   information about Amazon SWF service limits, see: <a>Amazon SWF
--   Service Limits</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
newRegisterDomain :: Text -> Text -> RegisterDomain

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newPollForDecisionTask</a> smart constructor.
data PollForDecisionTask
PollForDecisionTask' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Text -> TaskList -> PollForDecisionTask

-- | Create a value of <a>PollForDecisionTask</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identity:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTask_identity</a> - Identity of the decider making
--   the request, which is recorded in the DecisionTaskStarted event in the
--   workflow history. This enables diagnostic tracing when problems arise.
--   The form of this identity is user defined.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTask_nextPageToken</a> - If <tt>NextPageToken</tt>
--   is returned there are more results available. The value of
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is a unique pagination token for each page.
--   Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next
--   page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token
--   expires after 60 seconds. Using an expired pagination token will
--   return a <tt>400</tt> error: "<tt>Specified token has exceeded its
--   maximum lifetime</tt>".
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   The <tt>nextPageToken</tt> returned by this action cannot be used with
--   GetWorkflowExecutionHistory to get the next page. You must call
--   PollForDecisionTask again (with the <tt>nextPageToken</tt>) to
--   retrieve the next page of history records. Calling PollForDecisionTask
--   with a <tt>nextPageToken</tt> doesn't return a new decision task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPageSize:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTask_maximumPageSize</a> - The maximum number of
--   results that are returned per call. Use <tt>nextPageToken</tt> to
--   obtain further pages of results.
--   
--   This is an upper limit only; the actual number of results returned per
--   call may be fewer than the specified maximum.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reverseOrder:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTask_reverseOrder</a> - When set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   returns the events in reverse order. By default the results are
--   returned in ascending order of the <tt>eventTimestamp</tt> of the
--   events.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTask_domain</a> - The name of the domain containing
--   the task lists to poll.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTask_taskList</a> - Specifies the task list to poll
--   for decision tasks.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
newPollForDecisionTask :: Text -> TaskList -> PollForDecisionTask

-- | A structure that represents a decision task. Decision tasks are sent
--   to deciders in order for them to make decisions.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPollForDecisionTaskResponse</a> smart constructor.
data PollForDecisionTaskResponse
PollForDecisionTaskResponse' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Maybe WorkflowType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [HistoryEvent] -> Maybe Text -> Int -> Integer -> PollForDecisionTaskResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>PollForDecisionTaskResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousStartedEventId:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_previousStartedEventId</a> - The ID of
--   the DecisionTaskStarted event of the previous decision task of this
--   workflow execution that was processed by the decider. This can be used
--   to determine the events in the history new since the last decision
--   task received by the decider.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowExecution:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_workflowExecution</a> - The workflow
--   execution for which this decision task was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_workflowType</a> - The type of the
--   workflow execution for which this decision task was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:PollForDecisionTask'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_nextPageToken</a> - If a
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are more
--   results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call
--   again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep all
--   other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:events:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_events</a> - A paginated list of
--   history events of the workflow execution. The decider uses this during
--   the processing of the decision task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskToken:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_taskToken</a> - The opaque string used
--   as a handle on the task. This token is used by workers to communicate
--   progress and response information back to the system about the task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startedEventId:PollForDecisionTaskResponse'</a>,
--   <a>pollForDecisionTaskResponse_startedEventId</a> - The ID of the
--   <tt>DecisionTaskStarted</tt> event recorded in the history.
newPollForDecisionTaskResponse :: Int -> Integer -> PollForDecisionTaskResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListDomains</a> smart constructor.
data ListDomains
ListDomains' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> RegistrationStatus -> ListDomains

-- | Create a value of <a>ListDomains</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:ListDomains'</a>,
--   <a>listDomains_nextPageToken</a> - If <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is
--   returned there are more results available. The value of
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is a unique pagination token for each page.
--   Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next
--   page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token
--   expires after 60 seconds. Using an expired pagination token will
--   return a <tt>400</tt> error: "<tt>Specified token has exceeded its
--   maximum lifetime</tt>".
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPageSize:ListDomains'</a>,
--   <a>listDomains_maximumPageSize</a> - The maximum number of results
--   that are returned per call. Use <tt>nextPageToken</tt> to obtain
--   further pages of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reverseOrder:ListDomains'</a>, <a>listDomains_reverseOrder</a>
--   - When set to <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By
--   default, the results are returned in ascending alphabetical order by
--   <tt>name</tt> of the domains.
--   
--   <a>$sel:registrationStatus:ListDomains'</a>,
--   <a>listDomains_registrationStatus</a> - Specifies the registration
--   status of the domains to list.
newListDomains :: RegistrationStatus -> ListDomains

data CountClosedWorkflowExecutions

-- | Create a value of <a>CountClosedWorkflowExecutions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeFilter:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_typeFilter</a> - If specified,
--   indicates the type of the workflow executions to be counted.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagFilter:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_tagFilter</a> - If specified, only
--   executions that have a tag that matches the filter are counted.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeTimeFilter:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_closeTimeFilter</a> - If specified,
--   only workflow executions that meet the close time criteria of the
--   filter are counted.
--   
--   <tt>startTimeFilter</tt> and <tt>closeTimeFilter</tt> are mutually
--   exclusive. You must specify one of these in a request but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeFilter:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_startTimeFilter</a> - If specified,
--   only workflow executions that meet the start time criteria of the
--   filter are counted.
--   
--   <tt>startTimeFilter</tt> and <tt>closeTimeFilter</tt> are mutually
--   exclusive. You must specify one of these in a request but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeStatusFilter:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_closeStatusFilter</a> - If specified,
--   only workflow executions that match this close status are counted.
--   This filter has an affect only if <tt>executionStatus</tt> is
--   specified as <tt>CLOSED</tt>.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionFilter:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_executionFilter</a> - If specified,
--   only workflow executions matching the <tt>WorkflowId</tt> in the
--   filter are counted.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:CountClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>countClosedWorkflowExecutions_domain</a> - The name of the domain
--   containing the workflow executions to count.
newCountClosedWorkflowExecutions :: Text -> CountClosedWorkflowExecutions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newRegisterWorkflowType</a> smart constructor.
data RegisterWorkflowType
RegisterWorkflowType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterWorkflowType

-- | Create a value of <a>RegisterWorkflowType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</a> - If
--   set, specifies the default maximum duration for executions of this
--   workflow type. You can override this default when starting an
--   execution through the StartWorkflowExecution Action or
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to 0. Unlike some of the other timeout parameters in Amazon SWF, you
--   cannot specify a value of "NONE" for
--   <tt>defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</tt>; there is a one-year max
--   limit on the time that a workflow execution can run. Exceeding this
--   limit always causes the workflow execution to time out.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskPriority:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_defaultTaskPriority</a> - The default task
--   priority to assign to the workflow type. If not assigned, then
--   <tt>0</tt> is used. Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskList:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_defaultTaskList</a> - If set, specifies the
--   default task list to use for scheduling decision tasks for executions
--   of this workflow type. This default is used only if a task list isn't
--   provided when starting the execution through the
--   StartWorkflowExecution Action or <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt>
--   Decision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultChildPolicy:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_defaultChildPolicy</a> - If set, specifies the
--   default policy to use for the child workflow executions when a
--   workflow execution of this type is terminated, by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This default can be overridden when starting a workflow
--   execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_description</a> - Textual description of the
--   workflow type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - If set,
--   specifies the default maximum duration of decision tasks for this
--   workflow type. This default can be overridden when starting a workflow
--   execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultLambdaRole:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_defaultLambdaRole</a> - The default IAM role
--   attached to this workflow type.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't specify an IAM role when you start this
--   workflow type, the default Lambda role is attached to the execution.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_domain</a> - The name of the domain in which
--   to register the workflow type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_name</a> - The name of the workflow type.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:RegisterWorkflowType'</a>,
--   <a>registerWorkflowType_version</a> - The version of the workflow
--   type.
--   
--   The workflow type consists of the name and version, the combination of
--   which must be unique within the domain. To get a list of all currently
--   registered workflow types, use the ListWorkflowTypes action.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
newRegisterWorkflowType :: Text -> Text -> Text -> RegisterWorkflowType

--   fields.

--   returned there are more results available. The value of
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is a unique pagination token for each page.
--   Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next
--   page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token
--   expires after 60 seconds. Using an expired pagination token will
--   return a <tt>400</tt> error: "<tt>Specified token has exceeded its
--   maximum lifetime</tt>".
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartWorkflowExecution</a> smart constructor.
data StartWorkflowExecution
StartWorkflowExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> Text -> WorkflowType -> StartWorkflowExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>StartWorkflowExecution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_input</a> - The input for the workflow
--   execution. This is a free form string which should be meaningful to
--   the workflow you are starting. This <tt>input</tt> is made available
--   to the new workflow execution in the <tt>WorkflowExecutionStarted</tt>
--   history event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaRole:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_lambdaRole</a> - The IAM role to attach to
--   this workflow execution.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't attach an IAM role, any attempt to schedule a
--   Lambda task fails. This results in a
--   <tt>ScheduleLambdaFunctionFailed</tt> history event. For more
--   information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_childPolicy</a> - If set, specifies the
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution if it is terminated, by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This policy overrides the default child policy specified when
--   registering the workflow type using RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_taskPriority</a> - The task priority to use
--   for this workflow execution. This overrides any default priority that
--   was assigned when the workflow type was registered. If not set, then
--   the default task priority for the workflow type is used. Valid values
--   are integers that range from Java's <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt>
--   (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt> (2147483647). Higher
--   numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_taskList</a> - The task list to use for the
--   decision tasks generated for this workflow execution. This overrides
--   the <tt>defaultTaskList</tt> specified when registering the workflow
--   type.
--   
--   A task list for this workflow execution must be specified either as a
--   default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default task list was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a> - The total
--   duration for this workflow execution. This overrides the
--   defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout specified when registering the
--   workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds; an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. Exceeding this limit causes the workflow execution to
--   time out. Unlike some of the other timeout parameters in Amazon SWF,
--   you cannot specify a value of "NONE" for this timeout; there is a
--   one-year max limit on the time that a workflow execution can run.
--   
--   An execution start-to-close timeout must be specified either through
--   this parameter or as a default when the workflow type is registered.
--   If neither this parameter nor a default execution start-to-close
--   timeout is specified, a fault is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - Specifies the
--   maximum duration of decision tasks for this workflow execution. This
--   parameter overrides the <tt>defaultTaskStartToCloseTimout</tt>
--   specified when registering the workflow type using
--   RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   A task start-to-close timeout for this workflow execution must be
--   specified either as a default for the workflow type or through this
--   parameter. If neither this parameter is set nor a default task
--   start-to-close timeout was specified at registration time then a fault
--   is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_tagList</a> - The list of tags to associate
--   with the workflow execution. You can specify a maximum of 5 tags. You
--   can list workflow executions with a specific tag by calling
--   ListOpenWorkflowExecutions or ListClosedWorkflowExecutions and
--   specifying a TagFilter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_domain</a> - The name of the domain in which
--   the workflow execution is created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowId:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_workflowId</a> - The user defined identifier
--   associated with the workflow execution. You can use this to associate
--   a custom identifier with the workflow execution. You may specify the
--   same identifier if a workflow execution is logically a <i>restart</i>
--   of a previous execution. You cannot have two open workflow executions
--   with the same <tt>workflowId</tt> at the same time within the same
--   domain.
--   
--   The specified string must not start or end with whitespace. It must
--   not contain a <tt>:</tt> (colon), <tt>/</tt> (slash), <tt>|</tt>
--   (vertical bar), or any control characters (<tt>\u0000-\u001f</tt> |
--   <tt>\u007f-\u009f</tt>). Also, it must not <i>be</i> the literal
--   string <tt>arn</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:StartWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>startWorkflowExecution_workflowType</a> - The type of the workflow
--   to start.
newStartWorkflowExecution :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowType -> StartWorkflowExecution

-- | Specifies the <tt>runId</tt> of a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStartWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> smart

data StartWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>StartWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> with all

--   supporting this type running. You cannot create new workflow
--   executions of this type.</li>

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTerminateWorkflowExecution</a> smart constructor.
data TerminateWorkflowExecution
TerminateWorkflowExecution' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> TerminateWorkflowExecution

-- | Create a value of <a>TerminateWorkflowExecution</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:runId:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_runId</a> - The runId of the workflow
--   execution to terminate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_childPolicy</a> - If set, specifies the
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions of the workflow
--   execution being terminated. This policy overrides the child policy
--   specified for the workflow execution at registration time or when
--   starting the execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A child policy for this workflow execution must be specified either as
--   a default for the workflow type or through this parameter. If neither
--   this parameter is set nor a default child policy was specified at
--   registration time then a fault is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_details</a> - Details for terminating
--   the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_reason</a> - A descriptive reason for
--   terminating the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_domain</a> - The domain of the workflow
--   execution to terminate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowId:TerminateWorkflowExecution'</a>,
--   <a>terminateWorkflowExecution_workflowId</a> - The workflowId of the
--   workflow execution to terminate.
newTerminateWorkflowExecution :: Text -> Text -> TerminateWorkflowExecution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data TerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse
TerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse' :: TerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>TerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newTerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse :: TerminateWorkflowExecutionResponse

--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>describeActivityTypeResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeInfo:DescribeActivityTypeResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeActivityTypeResponse_typeInfo</a> - General information
--   about the activity type.
--   
--   The status of activity type (returned in the ActivityTypeInfo
--   structure) can be one of the following.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>REGISTERED</tt>  The type is registered and available.
--   Workers supporting this type should be running.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPRECATED</tt>  The type was deprecated using
--   DeprecateActivityType, but is still in use. You should keep workers
--   supporting this type running. You cannot create new tasks of this
--   type.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:configuration:DescribeActivityTypeResponse'</a>,

-- | Create a value of <a>GetWorkflowExecutionHistory</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is returned there are more results available.
--   The value of <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is a unique pagination token for
--   each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve
--   the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination
--   token expires after 60 seconds. Using an expired pagination token will
--   return a <tt>400</tt> error: "<tt>Specified token has exceeded its
--   maximum lifetime</tt>".

--   <a>getWorkflowExecutionHistory_reverseOrder</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, returns the events in reverse order. By default the
--   results are returned in ascending order of the <tt>eventTimeStamp</tt>
--   of the events.

--   <a>$sel:domain:GetWorkflowExecutionHistory'</a>,

--   execution for which to return the history.

-- | Create a value of <a>ListClosedWorkflowExecutions</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_typeFilter</a> - If specified, only
--   executions of the type specified in the filter are returned.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagFilter:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_tagFilter</a> - If specified, only
--   executions that have the matching tag are listed.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_nextPageToken</a> - If
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is returned there are more results available.
--   The value of <tt>NextPageToken</tt> is a unique pagination token for
--   each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve
--   the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination
--   token expires after 60 seconds. Using an expired pagination token will
--   return a <tt>400</tt> error: "<tt>Specified token has exceeded its
--   maximum lifetime</tt>".
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumPageSize:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_maximumPageSize</a> - The maximum
--   number of results that are returned per call. Use
--   <tt>nextPageToken</tt> to obtain further pages of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reverseOrder:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_reverseOrder</a> - When set to
--   <tt>true</tt>, returns the results in reverse order. By default the
--   results are returned in descending order of the start or the close
--   time of the executions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeTimeFilter:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_closeTimeFilter</a> - If specified,
--   the workflow executions are included in the returned results based on
--   whether their close times are within the range specified by this
--   filter. Also, if this parameter is specified, the returned results are
--   ordered by their close times.
--   
--   <tt>startTimeFilter</tt> and <tt>closeTimeFilter</tt> are mutually
--   exclusive. You must specify one of these in a request but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimeFilter:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_startTimeFilter</a> - If specified,
--   the workflow executions are included in the returned results based on
--   whether their start times are within the range specified by this
--   filter. Also, if this parameter is specified, the returned results are
--   ordered by their start times.
--   
--   <tt>startTimeFilter</tt> and <tt>closeTimeFilter</tt> are mutually
--   exclusive. You must specify one of these in a request but not both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeStatusFilter:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_closeStatusFilter</a> - If specified,
--   only workflow executions that match this <i>close status</i> are
--   listed. For example, if TERMINATED is specified, then only TERMINATED
--   workflow executions are listed.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionFilter:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_executionFilter</a> - If specified,
--   only workflow executions matching the workflow ID specified in the
--   filter are returned.
--   
--   <tt>closeStatusFilter</tt>, <tt>executionFilter</tt>,
--   <tt>typeFilter</tt> and <tt>tagFilter</tt> are mutually exclusive. You
--   can specify at most one of these in a request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domain:ListClosedWorkflowExecutions'</a>,
--   <a>listClosedWorkflowExecutions_domain</a> - The name of the domain
--   that contains the workflow executions to list.
newListClosedWorkflowExecutions :: Text -> ListClosedWorkflowExecutions

-- | Create a value of <a>ListWorkflowTypesResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:ListWorkflowTypes'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkflowTypesResponse_nextPageToken</a> - If a
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are more
--   results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call
--   again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep all
--   other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListWorkflowTypesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkflowTypesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:typeInfos:ListWorkflowTypesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listWorkflowTypesResponse_typeInfos</a> - The list of workflow type
--   information.
newListWorkflowTypesResponse :: Int -> ListWorkflowTypesResponse

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>ActivityTaskCancelRequested</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes
ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes' :: Integer -> Text -> ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>activityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the
--   <tt>RequestCancelActivityTask</tt> decision for this cancellation
--   request. This information can be useful for diagnosing problems by
--   tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:activityId:ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>activityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes_activityId</a> - The
--   unique ID of the task.
newActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes :: Integer -> Text -> ActivityTaskCancelRequestedEventAttributes
