-- | The configuration settings for a workflow execution including timeout
--   values, tasklist etc. These configuration settings are determined from
--   the defaults specified when registering the workflow type and those
--   specified when starting the workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionConfiguration
WorkflowExecutionConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> TaskList -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_lambdaRole</a> - The IAM role
--   attached to the child workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskPriority</a> - The priority
--   assigned to decision tasks for this workflow execution. Valid values
--   are integers that range from Java's <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt>
--   (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt> (2147483647). Higher
--   numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - The
--   maximum duration allowed for decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a> -
--   The total duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_taskList</a> - The task list used
--   for the decision tasks generated for this workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionConfiguration_childPolicy</a> - The policy to use
--   for the child workflow executions if this workflow execution is
--   terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution action
--   explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
newWorkflowExecutionConfiguration :: Text -> Text -> TaskList -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionConfiguration

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNew</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes</a>
--   smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Integer -> Text -> TaskList -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowType -> WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_input</a> - The
--   input provided to the new workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_lambdaRole</a> - The
--   IAM role to attach to the new (continued) workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_taskPriority</a> -
--   The priority of the task to use for the decisions of the new
--   (continued) workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - The total duration allowed for the new workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - The maximum duration of decision tasks for the new workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_tagList</a> - The
--   list of tags associated with the new workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:decisionTaskCompletedEventId:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_decisionTaskCompletedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>DecisionTaskCompleted</tt> event corresponding to
--   the decision task that resulted in the
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision that started this
--   execution. This information can be useful for diagnosing problems by
--   tracing back the chain of events leading up to this event.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:newExecutionRunId':WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_newExecutionRunId</a>
--   - The <tt>runId</tt> of the new workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_taskList</a> - The
--   task list to use for the decisions of the new (continued) workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> -
--   The policy to use for the child workflow executions of the new
--   execution if it is terminated by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes_workflowType</a> -
--   The workflow type of this execution.
newWorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes :: Integer -> Text -> TaskList -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowType -> WorkflowExecutionContinuedAsNewEventAttributes

-- | Contains the count of workflow executions returned from
--   CountOpenWorkflowExecutions or CountClosedWorkflowExecutions
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionCount</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionCount
WorkflowExecutionCount' :: Maybe Bool -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionCount

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionCount</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:truncated:WorkflowExecutionCount'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCount_truncated</a> - If set to true, indicates
--   that the actual count was more than the maximum supported by this API
--   and the count returned is the truncated value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:count:WorkflowExecutionCount'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionCount_count</a> - The number of workflow
--   executions.
newWorkflowExecutionCount :: Natural -> WorkflowExecutionCount

-- | Contains information about a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionInfo</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionInfo
WorkflowExecutionInfo' :: Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Maybe CloseStatus -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [Text] -> WorkflowExecution -> WorkflowType -> POSIX -> ExecutionStatus -> WorkflowExecutionInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:parent:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_parent</a> - If this workflow execution is a
--   child of another execution then contains the workflow execution that
--   started this execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeStatus:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_closeStatus</a> - If the execution status is
--   closed then this specifies how the execution was closed:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>COMPLETED</tt>  the execution was successfully
--   completed.</li>
--   <li><tt>CANCELED</tt>  the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows
--   the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is
--   closed.</li>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATED</tt>  the execution was force terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>FAILED</tt>  the execution failed to complete.</li>
--   <li><tt>TIMED_OUT</tt>  the execution did not complete in the alloted
--   time and was automatically timed out.</li>
--   <li><tt>CONTINUED_AS_NEW</tt>  the execution is logically continued.
--   This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was
--   started to carry on the workflow.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:cancelRequested:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_cancelRequested</a> - Set to true if a
--   cancellation is requested for this workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:closeTimestamp:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_closeTimestamp</a> - The time when the
--   workflow execution was closed. Set only if the execution status is
--   CLOSED.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_tagList</a> - The list of tags associated
--   with the workflow execution. Tags can be used to identify and list
--   workflow executions of interest through the visibility APIs. A
--   workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:execution:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_execution</a> - The workflow execution this
--   information is about.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_workflowType</a> - The type of the workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTimestamp:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_startTimestamp</a> - The time when the
--   execution was started.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStatus:WorkflowExecutionInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfo_executionStatus</a> - The current status of
--   the execution.
newWorkflowExecutionInfo :: WorkflowExecution -> WorkflowType -> UTCTime -> ExecutionStatus -> WorkflowExecutionInfo

data WorkflowExecutionInfos

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:nextPageToken:WorkflowExecutionInfos'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfos_nextPageToken</a> - If a
--   <tt>NextPageToken</tt> was returned by a previous call, there are more
--   results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call
--   again using the returned token in <tt>nextPageToken</tt>. Keep all
--   other arguments unchanged.
--   
--   The configured <tt>maximumPageSize</tt> determines how many results
--   can be returned in a single call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionInfos:WorkflowExecutionInfos'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionInfos_executionInfos</a> - The list of workflow
--   information structures.
newWorkflowExecutionInfos :: WorkflowExecutionInfos

-- | Contains the counts of open tasks, child workflow executions and
--   timers for a workflow execution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts
WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts' :: Maybe Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:openLambdaFunctions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openLambdaFunctions</a> - The count of
--   Lambda tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openActivityTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openActivityTasks</a> - The count of
--   activity tasks whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openDecisionTasks:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openDecisionTasks</a> - The count of
--   decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution can have at
--   most one open decision task.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openTimers:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openTimers</a> - The count of timers
--   started by this workflow execution that have not fired yet.
--   
--   <a>$sel:openChildWorkflowExecutions:WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionOpenCounts_openChildWorkflowExecutions</a> - The
--   count of child workflow executions whose status is <tt>OPEN</tt>.
newWorkflowExecutionOpenCounts :: Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> Natural -> WorkflowExecutionOpenCounts

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionSignaled</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> Text -> WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_input</a> - The inputs
--   provided with the signal. The decider can use the signal name and
--   inputs to determine how to process the signal.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:externalInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalInitiatedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt>
--   event corresponding to the <tt>SignalExternalWorkflow</tt> decision to
--   signal this workflow execution.The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event. This field is set only if
--   the signal was initiated by another workflow execution.
--

--   <a>$sel:externalWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_externalWorkflowExecution</a>
--   - The workflow execution that sent the signal. This is set only of the
--   signal was sent by another workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:signalName:WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes_signalName</a> - The name
--   of the signal received. The decider can use the signal name and inputs
--   to determine how to the process the signal.
newWorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes :: Text -> WorkflowExecutionSignaledEventAttributes

-- | Provides details of <tt>WorkflowExecutionStarted</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe WorkflowExecution -> ChildPolicy -> TaskList -> WorkflowType -> WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:input:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_input</a> - The input
--   provided to the workflow execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lambdaRole:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_lambdaRole</a> - The IAM
--   role attached to the workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:continuedExecutionRunId:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_continuedExecutionRunId</a>
--   - If this workflow execution was started due to a
--   <tt>ContinueAsNewWorkflowExecution</tt> decision, then it contains the
--   <tt>runId</tt> of the previous workflow execution that was closed and
--   continued as this execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentInitiatedEventId:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentInitiatedEventId</a>
--   - The ID of the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecutionInitiated</tt> event
--   corresponding to the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision to
--   start this workflow execution. The source event with this ID can be
--   found in the history of the source workflow execution. This
--   information can be useful for diagnosing problems by tracing back the
--   chain of events leading up to this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskPriority:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskPriority</a> - The
--   priority of the decision tasks in the workflow execution.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:executionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_executionStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - The maximum duration for this workflow execution.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskStartToCloseTimeout</a>
--   - The maximum duration of decision tasks for this workflow type.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagList:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_tagList</a> - The list of
--   tags associated with this workflow execution. An execution can have up
--   to 5 tags.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:parentWorkflowExecution:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_parentWorkflowExecution</a>
--   - The source workflow execution that started this workflow execution.
--   The member isn't set if the workflow execution was not started by a
--   workflow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow
--   execution is terminated, by calling the TerminateWorkflowExecution
--   action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:taskList:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_taskList</a> - The name of
--   the task list for scheduling the decision tasks for this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes_workflowType</a> - The
--   workflow type of this execution.
newWorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes :: ChildPolicy -> TaskList -> WorkflowType -> WorkflowExecutionStartedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionTerminated</tt>
--   event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe WorkflowExecutionTerminatedCause -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:details:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_details</a> - The
--   details provided for the termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_reason</a> - The reason
--   provided for the termination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cause:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_cause</a> - If set,
--   indicates that the workflow execution was automatically terminated,
--   and specifies the cause. This happens if the parent workflow execution
--   times out or is terminated and the child policy is set to terminate
--   child executions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
newWorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes :: ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTerminatedEventAttributes

-- | Provides the details of the <tt>WorkflowExecutionTimedOut</tt> event.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes</a> smart
--   constructor.
data WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes
WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes' :: WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutType:WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_timeoutType</a> - The type
--   of timeout that caused this event.
--   
--   <a>$sel:childPolicy:WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>workflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes_childPolicy</a> - The
--   policy used for the child workflow executions of this workflow
--   execution.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
newWorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes :: WorkflowExecutionTimeoutType -> ChildPolicy -> WorkflowExecutionTimedOutEventAttributes

-- | Represents a workflow type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowType</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowType
WorkflowType' :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowType

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowType</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkflowType'</a>, <a>workflowType_name</a> - The name of
--   the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:WorkflowType'</a>, <a>workflowType_version</a> - The
--   version of the workflow type.
--   
--   The combination of workflow type name and version must be unique with
--   in a domain.
newWorkflowType :: Text -> Text -> WorkflowType

-- | The configuration settings of a workflow type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowTypeConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowTypeConfiguration
WorkflowTypeConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TaskList -> Maybe ChildPolicy -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> WorkflowTypeConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowTypeConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultExecutionStartToCloseTimeout</a> -
--   The default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, for executions of this workflow type. This default can be
--   overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskPriority:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskPriority</a> - The default
--   task priority, specified when registering the workflow type, for all
--   decision tasks of this workflow type. This default can be overridden
--   when starting a workflow execution using the StartWorkflowExecution
--   action or the <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> decision.
--   
--   Valid values are integers that range from Java's
--   <tt>Integer.MIN_VALUE</tt> (-2147483648) to <tt>Integer.MAX_VALUE</tt>
--   (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.
--   
--   For more information about setting task priority, see <a>Setting Task
--   Priority</a> in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskList:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskList</a> - The default task
--   list, specified when registering the workflow type, for decisions
--   tasks scheduled for workflow executions of this type. This default can
--   be overridden when starting a workflow execution using the
--   StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultChildPolicy:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultChildPolicy</a> - The default
--   policy to use for the child workflow executions when a workflow
--   execution of this type is terminated, by calling the
--   TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired
--   timeout. This default can be overridden when starting a workflow
--   execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The supported child policies are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>TERMINATE</tt>  The child executions are terminated.</li>
--   <li><tt>REQUEST_CANCEL</tt>  A request to cancel is attempted for
--   each child execution by recording a
--   <tt>WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested</tt> event in its history. It is
--   up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an
--   execution history with this event.</li>
--   <li><tt>ABANDON</tt>  No action is taken. The child executions
--   continue to run.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultTaskStartToCloseTimeout</a> - The
--   default maximum duration, specified when registering the workflow
--   type, that a decision task for executions of this workflow type might
--   take before returning completion or failure. If the task doesn'tdo
--   close in the specified time then the task is automatically timed out
--   and rescheduled. If the decider eventually reports a completion or
--   failure, it is ignored. This default can be overridden when starting a
--   workflow execution using the StartWorkflowExecution action or the
--   <tt>StartChildWorkflowExecution</tt> Decision.
--   
--   The duration is specified in seconds, an integer greater than or equal
--   to <tt>0</tt>. You can use <tt>NONE</tt> to specify unlimited
--   duration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultLambdaRole:WorkflowTypeConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeConfiguration_defaultLambdaRole</a> - The default IAM
--   role attached to this workflow type.
--   
--   Executions of this workflow type need IAM roles to invoke Lambda
--   functions. If you don't specify an IAM role when starting this
--   workflow type, the default Lambda role is attached to the execution.
--   For more information, see
--   <a>https://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonswf/latest/developerguide/lambda-task.html</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon SWF Developer Guide</i>.
newWorkflowTypeConfiguration :: WorkflowTypeConfiguration

-- | Used to filter workflow execution query results by type. Each
--   parameter, if specified, defines a rule that must be satisfied by each
--   returned result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowTypeFilter</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowTypeFilter
WorkflowTypeFilter' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> WorkflowTypeFilter

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowTypeFilter</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:WorkflowTypeFilter'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeFilter_version</a> - Version of the workflow type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:WorkflowTypeFilter'</a>, <a>workflowTypeFilter_name</a> -
--   Name of the workflow type.
newWorkflowTypeFilter :: Text -> WorkflowTypeFilter

-- | Contains information about a workflow type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newWorkflowTypeInfo</a> smart constructor.
data WorkflowTypeInfo
WorkflowTypeInfo' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> WorkflowType -> RegistrationStatus -> POSIX -> WorkflowTypeInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>WorkflowTypeInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:deprecationDate:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_deprecationDate</a> - If the type is in deprecated
--   state, then it is set to the date when the type was deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_description</a> - The description of the type
--   registered through RegisterWorkflowType.
--   
--   <a>$sel:workflowType:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_workflowType</a> - The workflow type this
--   information is about.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>, <a>workflowTypeInfo_status</a> -
--   The current status of the workflow type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:creationDate:WorkflowTypeInfo'</a>,
--   <a>workflowTypeInfo_creationDate</a> - The date when this type was
--   registered.
newWorkflowTypeInfo :: WorkflowType -> RegistrationStatus -> UTCTime -> WorkflowTypeInfo
